article text: The gorgeous newlywed and talented actress, Ushna Shah recently shared some of her unseen wedding pictures on her social media account to celebrate three months of togetherness with her better half, Hamza Amin.  Take a look!  Ushna opted for a gorgeous net white gown for her wedding reception and she looked breathtakingly gorgeous in this lovely body-hugging dress.  She captioned,  If Montheversaries were a thing, today would be our 3rd. üê≠ ‚ô•Ô∏è üêé  Sneak peek at her barat d√©cor and intricate details of her wedding dress.  First travel after being Mrs. Hamza Amin.  A glimpse of her mehndi and some other get-togethers before officially becoming the pro golf player‚Äôs wife.  Another wedding reception‚Äôs memorable shots!  ALSO READ Laiba Khan Sets Hearts Racing in See-Through Black Saree  Ushna Shah is one of the most popular actresses in Pakistan. She has captivated audiences with her incredible acting skills and charming personality.  Ushna‚Äôs husband, Hamza Amin, is also an accomplished businessman and pro golfer. He has worked in many fields and has had a successful career in Austria. He and Ushna met and fell in love, and their love story has been an inspiration to many.  Visit the Lens celebrity portal to find out more about your favorite stars.

TEEN Mom Jade Cline has fans believing she's pregnant after noticing a suspicious trend in new photos.  The reality star is already a mom to a five-year-old daughter, Kloie, with her fianc√© Sean Austin, 29.  5 Fans think Jade Cline is pregnant after spotting clues in new photos Credit: Instagram / Jade Cline  5 Some think she's expecting after noticing she hasn't showed her belly in recent pics Credit: Instagram/jadecline_  However, some think another little one might be on the way based on clues they've found in recent pics.  One eagle-eyed fan raised the theory in a popular Teen Mom forum by posting the caption: "Call me crazy but I think Jade is pregnant. They got wedding pics done already. I haven't seen many belly pics, in fact seems like she's hiding her belly maybe? Lol"  The user was referring to Jade's recent Instagram posts, including one she posted earlier this month of her and Sean dressed in bride and groom attire.  She captioned it: "Only 4 months and 16 days left till we say 'I Do,'" along with the hashtag "#Mrs.Austin."  Despite Jade stating her upcoming wedding date, many of her followers found it odd that she already took wedding photos and suspected a pregnancy might be the reason.  One person bluntly commented that they thought Jade was expecting, writing: "Idk I have a baby bump feeling."  But the MTV star quickly shut down the speculation and replied: "Unfeel it lol I don‚Äôt want more kids for a long time lol."  YES TO THE DRESS  Jade's focus instead appears to be on her and Sean's big day, and she's been sharing updates with fans on the preparations.  In December, the 25-year-old shared that she had locked down a wedding dress, bringing her one step closer to marrying her baby daddy.  She posted a photo of herself alongside her mom Christy and pals, including fellow Teen Mom 2 star Briana DeJesus, 28.  In it, she held a sign that read: "I said yes to the dress," and wrote the same for her photo caption.  BABY PLANS  Jade and Sean's proposal played out during an episode of Teen Mom: The Next Chapter, with Jade taking to Instagram Stories after to chat with fans about her future plans.  The idea of adding to her brood was again brought up as someone asked: "Do you plan to have more kids?"  She didn't shy away from the question, revealing: "After the wedding, we want to start trying for our second!"  Jade previously confessed her desire to have more children while interacting with fans online.  During one instance where Jade invited "fun and interesting" comments from her Instagram followers, the TV personality gushed over her dreams with her future husband.  One fan playfully wrote to the star: "Sean's been looking like a snack."  In agreeance with the commenter, Jade honestly responded: "Definitely want more of his babies."  5 Jade recently shut down speculation that she's pregnant, claiming that she doesn't want more children for awhile Credit: Instagram/jadecline_  5 She has instead been focusing on her upcoming wedding to her fianc√© Sean Austin Credit: Instagram/ jadecline_

A bride got a surprise of a lifetime during her wedding when she was able to dance with not just her husband, but her bias as well.  This newlywed's photo during their first dance went viral for all the cute reasons‚Äîthe groom, Anton surprised his wife, Pat during their first dance by seemingly impersonating her K-pop bias, Jeonghan of Seventeen, who is also wearing a suit, as seen in a cutout photo.  Anton and Pat del Rosario shared to PhilSTAR L!fe that they are both fans of Seventeen since 2021. The latter shared that Jeonghan is her ultimate bias because of his visuals and personality.  ‚ÄúI find Jeonghan's visuals insane, especially after seeing him live when they held concerts here in the Philippines. I also love his personality!‚Äù she told L!fe. ‚ÄúI [also] enjoy watching their variety shows.‚Äù  Looking back to their special moment, Pat couldn‚Äôt help but laugh at her husband‚Äôs gimmick.  ‚ÄúI literally knelt down on the floor laughing. I was laughing so hard the entire time,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut of course, we still had our special moment after he placed down the Jeonghan hanger,‚Äù she added.  She also shared how supportive her husband is to her fangirling life ever since.  ‚ÄúHe doesn't mind me fangirling or buying K-pop merch as long as it will not take up too much of my time and that I don't forget my other priorities,‚Äù she said.

Share your email to get soaps interviews, spoilers from the Star  Coronation Street are known for their impressive weddings and grand gestures on the ITV Cobbles.  And fans are in a treat next week as Gemma Winter prepares to walk down the aisle in style to tie the knot to her childhood sweetheart Chesney Brown.  Viewers know little about the plans for the happy couple‚Äôs big day, but they fan-favourite character has already been dropping hints that it is going to be an unmissable event.  READ MORE: Corrie's Chris Fountain supported by co-stars as he issues health update after stroke  But she‚Äôs not the only bride set to go down in ITV history, with other memorable weddings on the cobbles including Les Battersby and Cilla Brown dramatic nuptials, Steve McDonald‚Äôs impressive seven marriages and not forgetting Deirdre and Ken‚Äôs heartbreaking wedding day.  As the fiery redhead puts the final finishing touches on her impressive gown, Daily Star has taken a deep dive inside some of the wildest engagements and dramatic weddings in the history of the long-running soap.  Sally pops the question to Tim  (Image: ITV)  One memorable proposal which must make the list is fan-favourite couple Sally and Tim Metcalfe and the countless times they did it.  When Sally and Tim first clocked eyes on one another back in 2013, not even Barlow‚Äôs Bookies would have put odds on the couple making a go of it.  Yet 10 years later not only are they still together, but they are one of Coronation Street‚Äôs most popular couples.  (Image: ITV)  The couple first got engaged by accident when Sophie‚Äôs girlfriend Maddie spotted Tim coming out of the jewellers and got the wrong end of the stick.  Months later, Tim did it again when he cheekily got down on one knee in the middle of the street and proposed not to get married when they both felt their relationship was moving too quickly.  Luckily, the blonde bombshell managed to change his mind when she returned the favour and got on bended knee in the middle of the street in a last-ditch effort to make things official.  (Image: ITV)  After breaking the builder‚Äôs heart when she drunkenly kissed Kevin Webster, Sally recruited the help of Craig Tinker and his impressive artistic skills to help make the best proposal possible.  The loveable policeman created two beautiful murals on Egyptian cotton bed sheets, one which had the phrase ‚ÄòTim marry me‚Äô on it and the other with a beautiful picture of Sally.  Luckily, after much persuasion, Tim managed to put her drunken night of passion behind them and tied the knot during a romantic ceremony back in 2020.  Tyrone proposes to Maria in Blackpool  (Image: ITV)  One proposal which has gone down in the Coronation Street history books is Tyrone Hobbs‚Äô first proposal on the street to childhood sweetheart Maria Connor.  The brunette beauty first joined the show back in 2000 as a kennel maid with the TV hunk, and it didn‚Äôt take long before their romance took off with a series of romantic dates.  And Tyrone made sure to pick the perfect place to pop the question to his beautiful bride to be, as he plucked up the courage to ask his girlfriend to become his wife on top of the Blackpool Tower.  (Image: ITV/REX/Shutterstock)  Everything seemed to be going swimmingly, with the happy couple sharing their exciting news with their loved ones and planning for their big day.  But after 12 months of planning, the TV heartthrob‚Äôs eyes started to wander over to fiery redhead Fiz Brown.  It‚Äôs fair to say when Maria found out Tyrone had been locking lips with another woman that Tyrone was in trouble with the fuming fianc√©e immediately calling off the wedding.  But it all worked out in the end, with Maria going on to find the love of her life with Liam Connor and tying the knot with him in 2008.  Steve‚Äôs wedding fever  (Image: ITV)  We couldn't share this list without giving an honourable mention to fan-favourite star Steve McDonald, who has been consistently unlucky in love during his time on the soap.  The loveable character - played by Simon Gregson - has been part of the furniture since he joined the long-running show back in 1989.  It's fair to say the soap star has been quite the womaniser on the show, after tying the knot throughout his 34-year reign.  (Image: ITV)  Bride number one was Vicky Arden, the granddaughter of Rovers landlord Alec Gilroy.  But it wasn't meant to be after the pair called time on their marriage two years later after he fell into the arms of hairdresser Fiona Middleton.  Steve later tied the knot to Karen Phillips who he walked down the aisle with not once but twice, with both weddings ended in tears.  (Image: PD UNKNOWN)  In 2001, the couple exchanged vows for the first time for a bet, but they soon realised they loved each other and got divorced so they could tie the knot properly in 2004.  However, their ceremony was interrupted by Tracy Barlow who revealed that she had a one night stand with the groom himself.  Despite the heartbreaking news, Karen tied the knot anyway but their marriage broke down just months later.  (Image: ITV)  Next up to wear the white gown was Rovers barmaid Michelle Connor, but he then cheated on Michelle with Becky Granger who he also married in 2009.  Sadly, their wedding bliss wasn't made to last, with Steve later returning to his former flame Tracy Barlow.  It didn't take long before the brunette beauty fell pregnant with twins, and being the gentleman he is, Steve decided to do the right thing and put a ring on her finger.  (Image: ITV)  But when he found out she had been lying about Becky causing her to miscarry her unborn twins, which she actually lost through natural causes, it was all over.  Following their divorce in 2015, Steve rekindled his relationship with Michelle who he tied the knot with later that year.  But after an argument, Steve slept with Leanne Battersby who later fell pregnant with his son Oliver.  (Image: ITV)  It's fair to say when Michelle found out about his infidelity, she threw him out the house and swiftly divorced him.  But that didn't stop the TV veteran from finding love again, after he rekindled his relationship with Tracy Barlow once again.  The happy couple later tied the knot in 2018, but that didn't mean their wedding went off without a hitch after she discovered that Steve had slept with her once again.  Luckily, Steve managed to get back in Tracy's good books and (for now) the happy couple have been going strong.  Les and Cilla‚Äôs star-studded wedding  (Image: ITV)  Another match made in heaven (or hell) has to be the Cilla Brown and Les Battersby who made sure their wedding went off with a bang.  In 2005, the happy couple decided to tie the knot largely so they could treat themselves to countless wedding presents from their friends and family.  But arguably the person who was most pleased by their nuptials was Chesney who was over the moon to be part of a real family for once.  (Image: Chris Neill)  However, their day certainly didn't go to plan after bride-to-be Cilla was pampered by best friend Yana who carefully styled her auburn locks into three sixes.  But the madness didn't end there after Les got caught up in a pre-wedding bust-up with one of the band member of Status Quo.  And the trouble didn't end there after Francis Rossi and Rick Parfitt locked horns just moments before he was duo to walk down the aisle.  (Image: Unknown)  Last time the star managed to escape the drunken brawl without so much as a scratch, but this time the TV legend was forced to wear a neck brace on his big day.  Luckily, the groom managed to patch things up with the band, and they even played at the happy couple's reception.  Ken and Deirdre‚Äôs heartbreaking reception  (Image: ITV)  They weren't the only happy couple to tie the knot that year, as legendary couple Deirdre and Ken remarried later that year.  Unfortunately, they day was set to end in tragedy when Deirdre's ex-husband Ray Langton died at the reception.  Ray made his return to Weatherfield when Tracy's father discovered he had stomach cancer.  (Image: ITV)  After learning about the devastating diagnosis, Tracy's dad managed to convince him to to return to the Cobbles to make amends with his daughter before it was too late.  Luckily he didn't have to look too hard to find his long-lost family, after he accidentally hit baby Amy Barlow's pram at the hospital.  It was at this point that he realised the tot was his granddaughter as he reconnected with his daughter Tracy.  (Image: ITV)  For more of the latest showbiz and TV news from the Daily Star, make sure you sign up to one of our newsletters here.  After he revealed that he had terminal stomach cancer, the family unit attended Ken and Deirdre's wedding to wish the happy couple well on their big day.  But during the reception which was held at the Rovers Return, Ray passed away much to Tracy's distress.  READ NEXT:

They wanted to keep it a secret, but it couldn‚Äôt be. Too many musicians, influencers and celebrities have attended the re-wedding that Willy Barcenas and his now wife since May 11, the writer Loreto Sesma, held this Saturday in Madrid. The party was able to be organized because the singer from Stool was finally able to reunite with his father, Luis Barcenasand his mother, Rosalia Iglesiaswho have managed to get out of jail with a prison permit to attend the celebration.  The well-known La Gaviota estate has been the place chosen to which many well-known faces have made a pilgrimage to celebrate the wedding, already legally sealed at the beginning of May, between Guillermo B√°rcenas and Loreto Sesma, this time with the groom‚Äôs parents outside from jail, where you are serving sentences for corruption offenses related to the G√ºrtel case.  (In preparation)

Get the latest showbiz news and gossip every day by signing up to our FREE newsletter  Peter O'Mahony has enjoyed a long and successful rugby career since making his debut with Munster in 2010.  The flanker features on both the United Rugby Championship club Munster and the Ireland national team.  But when he‚Äôs not training or on the pitch, he is a family man and a keen gardener.  Read more: Joey Carbery gets married to fianc√©e Robyn Flanagan in intimate court ceremony  Who is Peter‚Äôs wife?  Peter has been in a relationship with long-term partner Jessica Moloney for over a decade.  Jessica works as a solicitor and graduated from University College Cork with an Honours Law and French Degree in 2010.  The rugby player popped the big question while the couple were in Dubai in 2018.  Sharing the news on social media, Jessica joked: ‚ÄúAnd I was beginning to think that knee couldn't bend‚Äù.  (Image: Instagram)  When did Peter and Jessica get married?  The couple initially tied the knot in July 2020 during the middle of lockdown. They enjoyed an intimate garden ceremony, but promised there would be an ‚Äúafter party‚Äù down the line.  Their big wedding came in September 2022, with Peter and Jessica flying to France to get married for a second time surrounded by their family and close friends.  The bride shared snaps of the stunning wedding, writing: ‚ÄúGetting married once wasn‚Äôt enough.‚Äù  Jessica wore a classic white dress that was cinched at the waist and a long veil with her hair in loose curls.  Peter went with a white shirt opened around the neck with a navy suit jacket and trousers.  How many children do Peter and Jessica have?  Peter and Jessica share three children together - daughter Indie, aged 7, son Theo, aged 4 and two-year-old son Ralph.  Peter and his garden  (Image: Instagram)  Outside of rugby, Peter is known for having a green thumb and often shares updates on his luscious garden.  Not only does he have a meticulously manicured lawn, but he also grows a variety of plants and vegetables.  He transformed his back garden after purchasing his home eight years ago.  His love for gardening developed after spending time during the summer in West Cork as a child. By JT - May 27,2023 - Last updated at May 27,2023  AMMAN ‚Äî The Crown Prince Foundation (CPF) has launched an exclusive online platform designed for sending greetings to HRH Crown Prince Hussein and Miss Rajwa Alseif on their wedding, the Jordan News Agency, Petra, reported.  The platform is accessible to both local and international well-wishers at: https://celebratingalhussein.jo/

Although spring doesn't end for another few weeks, Dr. Nicole Martin is already in summer mode.  How to Watch Catch up on The Real Housewives of Miami on Peacock or the Bravo App.  The Real Housewives of Miami mom returned to Instagram on May 26 to share several photos of her family's St. Barths getaway. The certified anesthesiologist posted pictures of scenic cliffs and crystal-clear water; however, it was her stunning swimsuit that received the most compliments.  The carousel began with a photo of Nicole posing with her back toward the camera while rocking a teeny string bikini. The cheeky green design was created by Naomi Newirth's ACACIA, an eco-conscious label that specializes in sophisticated swimwear and women‚Äôs ready-to-wear garments. Nicole‚Äôs swimsuit featured a tonal horizontal pattern, a triangle top with adjustable straps, as well as side string ties with tassels on the end. The mother-of-one finished the look with a pair of black sneakers, a few gold bracelets, and some brown Oliver Peoples shades.  As shown on her Instagram, Nicole enjoyed the St. Barths outing with a couple of friends and her longtime partner, Anthony Lopez, with whom she shares a 4-year-old son.  ‚ÄúHappy [Memorial Day weekend],‚Äù she captioned the post. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve officially reached the start of summer!! Looking forward to our upcoming trips.‚Äù  Several Bravolebrities hopped in the comments section to provide a few flattering words for Nicole.  ‚ÄúLil hottie with bodyody!‚Äù wrote Southern Charm and Southern Hospitality‚Äôs Leva Bonaparte.  ‚ÄúBaby got back,‚Äù added RHOM‚Äôs Adriana de Moura.  This isn‚Äôt the first time Nicole has delivered a sizzling swimsuit look. The University of Miami alumna has slayed in a black two-piece design with gold accents, a playful denim bikini top with ruffles, and a striking leopard print swimsuit with knot details.  Related  Nicole and Anthony are no strangers to the jet-set lifestyle. The couple frequently takes to social media to document their travels, which have included stops in Aspen, Paris, Capri, and the Bahamas. The Miami mom spoke about her wanderlust during RHOM Season 5, when she had her castmates flew to the Caribbean for a girls‚Äô trip.  ‚ÄúI love to travel,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúLike, I am the first one to jump on a plane and go anywhere for any amount of time...‚Äù  Photo: Nicole Martin/Instagram  So, what's Nicole‚Äôs next adventure? It may be her wedding with Anthony. The two got engaged on New Year‚Äôs Eve 2021, after several years of dating. Though the couple has not formally announced a wedding date, Nicole told People magazine she and her fianc√© were eyeing a destination ceremony.  ‚ÄúI just love the idea of the destination wedding vibe,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIn Miami, you get married, you‚Äôve got four hours, and the party‚Äôs over. But when you travel, you‚Äôve got a welcome night, then you have a day party, then the night party, and it‚Äôs four or five days where you really get to enjoy your people.‚Äù

Bigg Boss 16 fame Gori Nagori brutally attacked by her brother-in-law  In an unsavoury incident, dancer and Bigg Boss 16 star Gori Nagori claims she was allegedly physically assaulted by her brother-in-law(elder sister's husband) and his friends. This incident took place in Ajmer‚Äôs Kishangarh in Rajasthan at Gori‚Äôs sister‚Äôs wedding.Gori along with her team, including her boyfriend Sunny Choudhary went to attend her younger sister Yasmin‚Äôs wedding on May 22. The nikah ceremony had concluded and while the family was preparing for the dulhan‚Äôs bidaai, a group of people attacked Gori‚Äôs boyfriend Sunny. When Gori tried to intervene, she was also attacked.Says Gori, ‚ÄúI came here to attend my sister‚Äôs wedding. We were so happy and were all preparing for Yasmin‚Äôs bidaai. Sunny and a few others were dancing on the floor. I went there to ask them to join us for the bidaai ceremony. But I don‚Äôt know what went wrong and my jijaji (Javed Hussain) and his friends picked up a fight with Sunny. The verbal spat soon turned into an ugly fight. They started beating him. He was injured and a bouncer, Rajesh was badly injured. When I tried to intervene they pulled my hair. I‚Äôm still in a state of shock."She further adds, ‚ÄúWhen we went to the local police station, they did not register our complaint. In fact I was told ‚ÄòYeh toh ghar ka mamla hai. But they did not hesitate to ask for pictures even when I was so upset. They were even clicking selfies with me.‚Äù Gori who‚Äôs returned to Delhi, plans to return to Kishangarh in a day or two to file a complaint.

The Yorkshire victims of a cruel wedding scammer have spoken of their heartbreak at finding they had been fleeced out of thousands only three days before they were due to tie the knot.  Nicky and Jason Asquith-Thorpe from Harrogate were conned by swindler Dana Twidale, a wedding planner from Hull. The couple discovered they had been fleeced out of ¬£3,500, paid to Twidale to organise their big day, just three days before the ceremony itself.  The pair will speak about their horrific experience in new TV documentary 'The Big Swindle' due to air this evening (Saturday, May 27) on Quest Red. Twidale was sentenced to five years in prison in 2021 after admitting 26 counts of fraud, reports Hull Live.  Read More: Woman's frustration as taxi firm stops her from pre-booking a cab because of her wheelchair  In the new documentary, The Big Swindle: The Wedding Planner Scammer, Nicky and Jason tell how their dreams turned to dust when Twidale ‚Äì whom they considered a friend ‚Äì failed to meet them at the venue as planned days before the wedding. Nicky said: ‚ÄúWe all went to the venue together ‚Ä¶ so my mum, my auntie, myself, Jason, my children. We were hoping that Dana would already be there with her van putting the marquee up ‚Ä¶ and the chairs and the tables.‚Äù  When they arrived, Dana was nowhere to be seen. Jason said: ‚ÄúThere was no van, there was no marquee, no nothing. There was a car parked with a couple sat in it that we‚Äôd never seen before, we assumed that one of them was Dana. They were the people that she‚Äôd hired to come and fill the marquee ‚Äì to make it really special for us. And they were still none the wiser, they assumed she was going to turn up as well.‚Äù  Shockingly, rather than come clean, Twidale had strung the couple along up to the very last minute. Nicky added: ‚ÄúThis is the worst bit ‚Äì Dana had messaged me saying ‚Äòwe‚Äôre running late, don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôll be there.‚Äô And that was the last message I received from her.‚Äù  In the documentary, which is due to air tonight (Saturday May 27) at 10pm on Quest Red, the couple explain how Twidale failed to answer their increasingly desperate calls. ‚ÄúBy lunchtime she hadn‚Äôt turned up. We kept ringing and it‚Äôd just ring through," said Jason.  "So then we thought it might be a problem with the phones, so then I rang, then someone else rang. The couple that were there to put the marquee together rang, there was just no answer. We didn‚Äôt know what happened we didn‚Äôt know if something was wrong with her.‚Äù  The offences happened between 2017 and 2019. When her betrayal of trust was publicised in July 2019, she fled the UK and was pictured sunning it up in Benidorm on her ill-gotten gains.  Among Twidale's other victims was a man she met on Tinder. She lied to him, claiming she was the victim of domestic violence, and begged him for money to pay for her mum‚Äôs funeral ‚Äì despite her mother being alive and well. He paid her more than ¬£42,000, leaving him ‚Äúan emotional and financial wreck‚Äù.  At a later Proceeds of Crime hearing, it was revealed that Twidale's crimes had netted her ¬£60,263, but her remaining assets were valued at a only ¬£600, enough to reimburse one of the victims just ¬£1.74.  The Big Swindle, a series on Quest Red, tells the stories of the most brazen and ruthless con artists and the victims they preyed on. Focusing on one story of devestating deceit each episode, those affected reveal the shocking details of what happened and a forensic psychiatrist helps unpack the mindset of the swindlers, as well as social media posts, emails and text messages, to reveal how and why these complicated cons were executed.  The Wedding Planner Scammer is episode three of the series. It can be viewed at 10pm on Saturday May 27. Quest Red is on Freeview, channel 40.  Read Next:

[Sebastian Staacks] built a video booth for his wedding, and the setup was so popular with family, that it was only fitting to do one better and make some improvements to the setup, Matrix-style. The ‚Äúbullet time‚Äù video effect was introduced by the classic movie franchise and makes for a splendid video transition effect for video montages.  Hardware-wise, the effect is pretty expensive, requiring many cameras at various angles to be simultaneously triggered, in order to capture the subject in a fixed pose with a rotating camera. Essentially you need as many cameras as frames in the sequence, so even at 24 frames per second (FPS), that‚Äôs a lot of hardware. [Sebastian] cheated a bit, and used a single front-facing camera for the bulk of the video recording, and twelve individual DSLRs covering approximately 90 degrees of rotation for the transition. More than that is likely impractical (not to mention rather expensive) for an automated setup used in as chaotic an environment as a wedding reception! So, the video effect is quite the same as in the movies, as this is a fixed pose, but it still looks pretty good.  [Sebastian] did consider going down the Raspberry Pi plus Pi-cam route, but once you add in a lens and the hassle of the casing and mounting hardware, not to mention availability and cost, snagging a pile of old DLSRs looks quite attractive. Connectivity to the camera is a simple 3.5 mm jack for the focus and trigger inputs, with frames read out via a USB connection.  For practical deployment, the camera batteries were replaced with battery eliminator adapters which step-up the 5 V from the USB connection to the 7.4 V the cameras need, but the current spike produced by the coordinated trigger of all twelve cameras overwhelmed any power supply available. The solution, to be practical, and not at all elegant, is to just have lots of power supplies hidden in a box. Sometimes you‚Äôve just got a job to do.  Reproducing this at home might be a bit awkward unless you have exactly the same hardware to hand, but the principles are sound, and there are a few interesting details to dig into, if you were so inclined.  We‚Äôve seen a few takes on the bullet-time effect over the years. We featured a Raspberry Pi-based hack, a couple of years back, and earlier still, someone even built a rig to take bullet-time videos of Tesla coil discharges, because why not?

Wedding photos of minor daughters of TN Chidambaram temple priests surface  The development comes a day after NCPCR member Dr RG Anand claimed that the priests‚Äô daughters were not subjected to child marriage and that the children were forced to say they were.  news News  Photographs from the marriage ceremonies of the minor daughters of priests at the Chidambaram Natarajar temple in Tamil Nadu have surfaced on the internet. The development comes a day after Dr RG Anand, member of the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR), claimed in a press conference that the Dhikshitars‚Äô (priests) underage daughters were not subjected to child marriage and that the children were forced to say they were. Dr Anand‚Äôs claims were in line with the allegations made by Governor RN Ravi.  At least three child brides can be spotted in the photographs that are now circulating the internet. A state government official confirmed to TNM that the photos were indeed captured during the wedding ceremony of the priests‚Äô daughters. Family members of the children are also identifiable in the images. As per media reports, the images were procured from the cell phones of the Dhikshitars themselves.  ‚ÄúThe Department of Social Welfare has submitted evidence to the police including photos from the weddings, receipts from the halls where the child marriages took place, wedding invitations, and the thamboolam bags (yellow bags carrying the names of the bride and groom presented to those attending the weddings). Hence, no one can claim that child marriages never took place,‚Äù said a source from the state government. The source confirmed that the grooms were also minors in some of these cases.  Vasuki Umanath, national vice president of the All India Democratic Women‚Äôs Association (AIDWA), said it was deplorable that this child marriage took place and the Governor is denying it. ‚ÄúIt appears as though [the Governor] is supporting child marriages, which is prohibited by law. He is crossing the constitutional line. The Sangh ideology is being increasingly imposed and even the NCPCR member [Anand] seems to have been pressured to comply,‚Äù she said.  Devaneyan, a child rights activist from Tamil Nadu, told TNM that he is saddened to see the state‚Äôs superior authorities functioning against the best interests of the children. ‚ÄúThe question that has arised is whether the NCPCR is functioning in the best interests of the children or the Governor. It is clear that the NCPCR is favouring the latter because they have even denied the evidence that had already been processed by authorities,‚Äù he said.  Sources from the Police Department said they suspect 52 child marriages to have taken place in Chidambaram since 2021. At present, they are gathering strong evidence to book six more child marriage cases, they said.  The All Women‚Äôs Police Station in Chidambaram have already booked four cases under Section 366(a) (procuration of minor girl) of the Indian Penal Code and the 9th and 10th sections of the Prevention of Child Marriage Act, which are to be heard in court soon. Eight men and three women were arrested in this regard between September and October 2022. ‚ÄúWe are discussing if the cases must be heard in Chidambaram‚Äôs special court for the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO),‚Äù a source said.  In an interview with the Times of India published on May 4, Governor RN Ravi had alleged that the Social Welfare Department officials lodged ‚Äúfalse complaints‚Äù of child marriage against two priests of the Natarajar temple out of ‚Äúvengeance‚Äù, he had claimed. After media reports highlighted the Governor‚Äôs allegations, the NCPCR took suo motu cognisance to investigate the incident and declared that the governor‚Äôs allegations were ‚Äú100% true.‚Äù  On May 26, Dr Anand also strengthened the governor‚Äôs claim alleging that the two-finger virginity tests were carried out on the victims of child marriage cases and added that the NCPCR holds the evidence to prove it. However, the state officials denied the claim. Incidentally, media reports from May 25 had quoted Dr Anand as saying that there was no evidence the two-finger test was performed on the minors. A person who has read my columns weekly and knows of my connection with Sri Lanka contacted me asking for information about her visiting Sri Lanka to see the Asian elephants. She has travel around Africa and saw plenty of African elephants and is curious to see Asian elephants and the Sri Lankan people.  My info on the national parks where the Sri Lanka elephants roam is a bit outdated, so I sent out messages to trusted Sri Lanka friends to learn how the situation is now.  Each response back was something similar to this: ‚ÄúPlease let me know when your friend is coming. Will help her along. Do give her my number, it‚Äôs always good to have a local contact.‚Äù And, ‚ÄúLet me know if you need me to help, if you need me to get your friend tour assistance.‚Äù And, ‚ÄúPlease contact me and Mr. H. so we can both help your friend. Thanks.‚Äù  My friends have been so helpful and so willing to give my ‚Äúnew‚Äù friend help with whatever she may need. It made me tear up. Made me miss them and wonder if I‚Äôll ever get back there to see them.  They also gave me information on where best to see elephants in the wild. One place that I really loved was the elephants in Udawalawe National Park. Our guide there was respectful of the magnificent animals who came close to our Jeep. It was the first time I heard them rumble. I thought it was them warning us, but then I realized it was their way of communicating to each other. It was friendly. I have been forever since protective of them and in love with them.  As my wedding photography in Sri Lanka grew, my photo partner and I decided to never take photos of couples wanting to use elephants in their wedding pictures. One wedding brought the couple on the back of an elephant handled by a mahout (elephant handler) who was drunk and the elephant was in chains. I could barely photograph them because I was crying. That was the end of us taking photos of elephants in chains.  Over time elephants have been used and abused in all countries for labor and tourism. Just being one person, I can‚Äôt cure the situation, but I could stop promoting using elephants for wedding photos and didn‚Äôt care if we lost business because of it.  I now daily follow and promote the amazing work of Sheldrick Wildlife Trust (https://www.sheldrickwildlifetrust.org/), a nonprofit organization who are pioneers in the rescue and raising of orphaned elephants and rhinos in Kenya. Their work certainly lifts my spirits, and to watch the baby elephants and their antics is just the best!  On my latest visit to Santa Rosa for another (and hopefully final) procedure on my back, my friend Mabel drove me, as usual. When arriving at the surgery center we drove up a long hill and saw a woman struggling to walk the steep grade. Mabel left me in the car and walked down to assist the woman. Turns out the woman was severely disorientated and couldn‚Äôt find her car. She didn‚Äôt know what brand her car was. She‚Äôd been walking up and down streets trying to find it. It was 2:30 p.m. and hot. Mabel saw from her car keys the car was a Toyota. The woman said it was white. She had dropped off a friend and couldn‚Äôt remember where or who. Mabel walked with her and eventually found her car and her friend.  The woman asked Mabel, ‚ÄúWhy are you doing this?‚Äù  ‚ÄúBecause you looked like you could use some help,‚Äù said Mabel.  Helping others without any reason and giving without the expectation of receiving anything in return is what Mabel is all about. I never asked her to help me when my back became unbearable, she just helped. She has been there for me, along with her husband Bart and the friends I‚Äôve made along my journey.  What‚Äôs a girl to do?‚Ä¶pay kindness forward. Always.  Lucy Llewellyn Byard is currently a columnist for the Record-Bee. To contact her, email lucywgtd@gmail.com

Owner and CEO of Photobooth Jamaica Veronica Allen-Ettinger (left) shares in a photo with some members of her team  After near half a decade in the local industry, photo and video company Photobooth Jamaica Limited is positioning its lens to capture a greater share of the entertainment market, more so for weddings, birthdays and corporate events.  The St Ann-based company, which offers service through a growing fleet of high-quality photo and video booths, boast the use professional-grade equipment and technology which it uses to produce stunning photos and videos services to a network of customers islandwide.  Through a diverse range of photo and video booths, the company boast customisation options including props, print designs and video overlays, which it said are tailored to meet the preferences and needs of individual and corporate clients.  "While we have seen the rise of a few competitors in the last few years, we remain the only company that provides a range of different photo booths, including our standalone dream photo, dream mirror and 360 platform booths. We also recently acquired the innovative dream spin 'FREEDOM' overhead 360 video experience booth which is perfect for weddings, corporate events, and other special occasions," owner and CEO of Photobooth Jamaica Veronica Allen-Ettinger told the Jamaica Observer in a recent interview.  Photobooth Jamaica's Dream Spin 360 Video Booth set up for an event at the historic Bellefield Great House  Having injected capital of over US$25,000 to build out the business since it first debuted to market in 2018, Technical Director Shaun Ettinger said that while current demand has not yet reached peak levels, plans are afoot to double down on a greater segment of the entertainment and events industry, with hopes to add new client√®le and to rake in more gigs.  "The photo booth business is a very small niche of the wedding and events industry, as not all events will request the service. We have photo booths rentals ranging from $30,000-$100,000 per hour depending on the type of event, booth and options included among other factors. However, while we do all types of events, we have been actively placing a lot of focus on the wedding market as we try to meet the need for having more real-time video and photography fun sessions for guests especially during the cocktail hour," he said to Sunday Finance.  "A large number of our client√®le are customers from overseas in the US, Canada and the UK, who seek out our services for their destination weddings and other events they want to celebrate when on visit to the island," he added.  The technical director, who has also not ruled out a pivoting of the company's services beyond local shores, said talks remain ongoing as he along with his wife looks to, over time, tap into new areas for growth.  Photobooth Jamaica's Dream Photo Booth set-up with optional inflatable enclosure at an event  "Expanding to other areas of the Caribbean has definitely been an area of consideration for us even as our services locally remain primary and foremost in all discussions for moving forward. Looking across the Caribbean, we see opportunities in countries such as the Cayman Islands, Grenada and the Dominican Republic which we will be specifically targeting based on the potential of their tourism and wedding industries," he said  "We want to grow organically as we continue to invest in state-of-the-art equipment and any other innovative equipment coming to the industry. One of the photo booths we're now working on is a robotic arm dream Glam Bot which can capture short video segments, which is now one of the hottest things in Los Angeles for red carpet events. It's now in the development and testing stage with plans for roll-out later in the year," he further said, noting that the recent addition of a karaoke services and a VIP programme for large clients will help to provide an added boost for the business.  Now recovering from the devastating fall-outs of the novel coronavirus pandemic, which completely shuttered the entertainment industry and the hosting of events for near two years, Ettinger said the company is now on the hunt for greater fortunes as moves bullishly to restore lost earnings.  "[The year] 2022 proved to be our best year in business surpassing pre-pandemic levels, but for 2023, we hope to have even better results. For this year, our hope is to match or even surpass last year's performance even as some amount of uncertainty exist globally," he stated.

Post by ANI on Sunday, May 28, 2023  A soulful Kashmiri song titled 'Kya Karie Korimol' has taken the internet by storm. It's a heartwarming tribute to the bond that father and daughter share on a wedding day.  The song depicts a journey through the emotions of a bride on her wedding day. The song released by Coke Studio India has garnered 1 million views, capturing the hearts of people not only in Kashmir but also across the globe.  The track beautifully encapsulates the profound love, protection, and compassion that envelops a father-daughter relationship, showcasing its unwavering strength as it evolves over time. The emotional journey of a bride and her father as they prepare for her wedding feast is artfully portrayed through poignant and melancholic lyrics.  The song features Alif, an acclaimed poet, singer, and songwriter, who previously won the prestigious IRAA Award for his single 'Like A Sufi.' Known for his deeply introspective lyrical compositions, Alif weaves colloquial references to society into his work, captivating listeners with his unique storytelling.  Playback singer and actor Aashima Mahajan added a soulful touch to the composition. Additionally, Noor Mohammad, a traditional Sufi music performer and songwriter hailing from Handwara in North Kashmir, brought his expertise and enriches the song with his contributions.  The collaboration of trio- Alif, Aashima Mahajan, and Noor Mohammad resulted in a harmonious blend of talent, skill, and heartfelt emotions, leaving listeners spellbound.  The enchanting melody resonates not only with Kashmiris but also with people worldwide who appreciate and cherish the beauty of Kashmiri culture.  Talking about the success of the song, Creative Producer Ankur Tewari expressed his delight, said "We are thrilled to witness the overwhelming response to 'Kyakariekorimol.' This song truly captures the essence of the father-daughter bond, and we are grateful to Alif, Aashima Mahajan, and Noor Mohammad for their exceptional artistry."  The song composed and written by Alif. Aman Moroney, ALIF, and Ashish Manchanda produced the song, ensuring its flawless execution.  Alif's mesmerizing vocals and acoustic guitars create an unforgettable musical experience, while the Wanwun Vocals by Zartasha Zainab, Shivani Matyal, Samhita Shiledar, Samiyah Nabi, and Rumuz-e-Bekhudi add depth and richness to the composition.  The 'Wanvun' couplets compiled by Rumuz Bekhudi and Alif, serve as a poignant addition to the song.  Not only that, Rumuz has also efficiently translated the whole song, as given in the video captions, making it accessible and palatable to non-kashmiri readers across the globe.  As the world continues to embrace the magical harmonies of "Kyakariekorimol," it becomes evident that this extraordinary father-daughter saga has struck a universal chord, uniting people through the power of music and love.  For enamoured listeners, "This song is a masterpiece that beautifully portrays the unbreakable bond between a father and daughter. It truly touches the soul and leaves an everlasting impact."(ANI)

Put it in the baby books.  Fans on Cameo have requested that legendary Mets radio broadcaster Howie Rose reveal whether they are having a boy or a girl.  ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of ‚ÄòHere‚Äôs our gender reveal, would you announce to everybody what we‚Äôre having,'‚Äù Rose told The Post of his account on Cameo, where a celebrity records personalized video messages for a fee. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fun.‚Äù  Other requests have included ‚Äúintroducing the bride and groom at their wedding or a bar mitzvah or something like that,‚Äù said Rose, 69, whose talking bobblehead is being handed out at CitiField on May 31.  Perfect timing, because on June 3 Rose will join players Howard Johnson and Al Leiter and fellow broadcaster Gary Cohen in being inducted into the Mets Hall of Fame at Citi Field.  Twitter users have called for Rose to be honored with the polyresin replica for years.  ‚ÄúBy popular demand, absolutely. They‚Äôre banging down the doors to get a Howie Rose bobblehead,‚Äù Rose said of the doll, which utters his famous catchphrase ‚ÄúPut it in the books.‚Äù  Rose‚Äôs bobblehead utters his famous catchphrase, ‚ÄúPut it in the books.‚Äù Noah K. Murray-NY Post  Rose was initially opposed to joining social media, and didn‚Äôt create a Twitter account until 2020.  ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt trust myself because I know me and I figure I‚Äôll have dinner and ‚Ä¶ maybe a couple of glasses of wine, and then I‚Äôll think, ‚ÄòYou know what? Yeah, I could say this.‚Äô‚Äù  However, once the pandemic hit, he felt disconnected from his listeners and decided to post his first tweet ‚Äî not realizing he did it on the same date, April 11, that the Mets played their first game.  ‚ÄúIt was pure irony ‚Ä¶ I just realized it later that night and said, ‚ÄòOh, this is spooky,'‚Äù he remembered.  The Brooklyn native who grew up in Bayside, Queens, remembers when he would attend baseball games at Shea Stadium when general admission was just $1.30 and the bus ride there 15 or 20 cents.  ‚ÄúIf I could scrounge two bucks off of my parents, which was a challenge ‚Ä¶ I still had money left over to buy a scorecard and maybe a hot dog,‚Äù he recalled.  The Brooklyn native, who grew up in Queens, recalled attending Mets games at Shea Stadium for $1.30. Sam Valorose  Now, his stadium food of choice is sushi from Daruma of Tokyo.  ‚ÄúTo me, sushi is the new pizza,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd whenever I get a chance, I try to have that before a game.‚Äù  He admitted to shedding a tear on air, when the team won the National League pennant in 2015.  ‚ÄúAs I was finishing my final call, if you listen very carefully ‚Ä¶ I said, ‚ÄòThey‚Äôre going to the World Series‚Äô and you could hear my voice crack just a little bit,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúBecause it was sort of your whole career, your ambitions and your dreams being crystallized in that moment.‚Äù  Fans on Cameo requested that legendary Mets radio broadcaster Howie Rose reveal their baby‚Äôs sex. Courtesy Howie Rose  Earlier this year, he revealed his battle with bladder cancer, and has received an outpouring of support.  ‚ÄúSince then, I‚Äôve had a number of people get in touch with me whom I‚Äôve had conversations, trying to help them through something similar that they‚Äôre going through ‚Ä¶ And it‚Äôs been somewhat cathartic,‚Äù he said.  Rose has no plans of retiring anytime soon and is hoping he can one day announce a World Series win for his beloved team.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm hoping that happens this year,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd if not, next year and God willing and health willing, I‚Äôll hang on as long as I can to have a chance to make that call.‚Äù

A wedding ceremony in the Mamoond (Chengai) tehsil of bajaur abruptly came to a halt when an unexpected incident unfolded. The brother of the bride took it upon himself to disrupt the festivities, bringing the joyous occasion to a screeching halt.  In an act driven by his interpretation of Islamic teachings, he abruptly ceased the music and proceeded to demolish all the musical instruments used by the local artists. Among the affected musicians was‚ÄúRabab Nawaz‚Äù Imran Ustad, a highly skilled artist and a devoted father of six residing in Tehsil Khar, Bajaur.  A Family's Sole Dependence Shattered in an instant  Imran Ustad, who had spent three decades enchanting audiences with his captivating performances at wedding ceremonies, recounted the distressing incident to TNN. He expressed his deep disappointment, explaining that he and his fellow musicians were invited to provide musical entertainment, but were met with aggression instead. Without any dialogue or warning, the man approached them and began violently kicking and destroying their instruments.  These instruments held immense significance for Imran Ustad and his entire family, as their livelihood depended on them. Losing over sixty thousand rupees worth of equipment, they were not only financially affected but also emotionally distraught.  Also Read: bannu: young man killed and body set on fire over alleged dog killing  Imran Ustad lamented the ordeal, stating,‚ÄúWe arrived with the sole intention of spreading happiness and could never fathom causing harm, yet we were subjected to such mistreatment.‚Äù  ‚ÄúExtremism Unleashed‚Äù  An anonymous local resident disclosed that the individual responsible for breaking the musical instruments belonged to a religious group:‚ÄúHe had requested his brother to end the music program, but the brother continued the concert for over an hour and a half, which infuriated him. Consequently, he resorted to breaking the instruments.‚Äù  In the aftermath of the incident, the local community rallied together, collected donations, and presented them to the affected artists as a gesture of apology. It was recognized that the act of breaking artists' instruments constituted an act of extremism.  In a related development, the Tehsil Salarzai Jirga had taken a decision last year to prohibit music in the area. The decree stated that anyone organizing a musical event or inviting talented singers from outside the village would face a complete social boycott. Moreover, the residents would abstain from participating in their joyous and sorrowful occasions, and the scholars would refuse to officiate their weddings.  Rashid Ahmad Khan, the president of the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Singers Association and the first singer to obtain a Ph.D. in music, condemned the incident that occurred in Tehsil Mamoond, Bajaur. He described it as a grave injustice and expressed that no amount of condemnation could suffice.  He firmly asserted that music is a symbol of peace and that no one has the right to forcefully destroy artists' instruments. Such acts, he emphasized, amounted to extremism.  Rashid Khan called upon the district administration and the District Police Officer of Bajaur to take decisive legal action against the individuals responsible for the incident and to ensure that the affected local artists are duly compensated for their losses.  Music: Is it Forbidden?  The question of whether music is permissible or forbidden became a subject of discussion. Maulana Khanzeb stated that Pashtuns have their own cultural practices intertwined with Islamic teachings.  He highlighted several areas where Pashto customs and Islamic principles align, such as purdah (veiling), modesty, halal and haram (permissible and forbidden), hospitality, rights of neighbors, and the Jirga system.  Maulana Khanzeb explained that music is not a matter of disbelief or faithfulness. Within Islam, there are two different perspectives on music: one holds that it is entirely forbidden and has no place within the religion, while the other tradition, represented by Imam Farabi and other scholars, permits conditional music.  According to this viewpoint, Maulana argued, as long as the music is accompanied by righteous poetry and does not encourage sinful or immoral behavior, it can be justified. Qawwali, a form of devotional music, finds validation within the realm of Sufism, he added.  Hits: 4

Wallace and Minnie Wallace of Bogue Chitto were wed on Memorial Day Weekend and a family reunion is held each year to celebrate the Wallace family.  ‚ÄúWe of course love all of our family from Mississippi to Alabama, Kansas, Arkansas, Michigan and Nebraska and probably a few more states in-between,‚Äù the Clouds said.

Peaches And The Jilted Bride  Episode 11 of Fantasy Island season 2 starts with Elena finding Ruby sleeping by the beach. She came out to look for Isla who keeps ghosting her but fell asleep. Elena advises her to forget about Isla.  Today‚Äôs guest is Laura, a jilted bride who arrives still wearing her wedding dress with no luggage. Laura is going through a rough time after her ex-fiance failed to show up to the wedding. He only sent her a text saying he can‚Äôt marry her. Laura thinks the disagreements before the wedding might have led to the breakup, and she is on the island to heal and be away from her self-obsessed parents, who are competing for her attention.  She is the only child and ever since her parents divorced, they have made it their mission to make her life a living hell. She is on the Island to also find her imaginary friend Peaches who made her feel loved. Her fantasy is to feel loved completely.  Later on, Elena asks Javier to join her for dinner with Ruby and Segmundo. She is hoping this will cheer Ruby up and make her forget about Isla for a while.  Laura settles in her room and starts her fantasy. She finds Peaches waiting for her in the room and they excitedly reunite. Peaches is still young in mind and is happy to be with Laura since it is clear that she needs her. She is saddened to her about Laura‚Äôs failed wedding and does her best to cheer her up. The room reverts to Laura‚Äôs old room and they reminisce about their young days when they fangirled over Backstreet Boys.  They then head to the bar where Laura tells Peaches about Brad and how they have aged. Laura is pleased that Peaches is visible to other people. Peaches is quick to bash Brad for dumping Laura. As they talk, Laura vents about the peeves Brad had and refuses to pick up her parent‚Äôs calls. Laura gets angry at Brad and takes it out on her wedding dress but she realizes that she is still in love with him.  Meanwhile, Elena invites Ruby to the dinner party the next evening. Ruby is happy to be invited and expresses her gratitude for having Elena as a friend. Isla makes a return and confesses her love for Ruby.  The next morning, Laura wakes up to find her parents are on the Island because Peaches called them. Laura is not happy to see them but her mom tells her how she handled everything on her own. Her dad talks about dealing with the vendors and his plans to sue Brad. The parents continue to argue about the lawsuit and never let Laura speak up.  Laura leaves to talk with Peaches and confront her about calling her parents. Peaches asks her to talk to her parents about the pain they are causing her. Her parents are focused on their feelings and ignore what Laura might be feeling.  Elsewhere, Isla tells Ruby that Elena asked her to stay away because they have bad blood with each other. Ruby is hesitant to believe her and asks her to explain everything. After hearing what Isla had to say, Ruby storms into Elena‚Äôs office angry and accuses her of betraying their friendship. She tells Elena that she doesn‚Äôt get to decide for her if she wants to be with a mermaid or not.  Elena tries to explain she is only trying to protect her as Isla is already in her head. The song she keeps hearing is a siren and Isla is not to be trusted. However, Ruby is still pissed and thinks she can‚Äôt trust Elena. By the time night rolls by, Elena and Ruby are still mad at each other. Elena forgets to cancel the evening dinner and Javier is the first to arrive.  Segundo shows up and leaves when he sees these two together. Javier listens to Elena and tries to comfort her. The night deepens and Javier and Elena get cosier. They end up sleeping together.  Back to Laura, she is invited to the beach bar by Peaches and arrives to find her reading her childhood diary. Her parents are also present and hear everything. They are obviously shocked to hear what Laura really thinks about their parenting. She finally confronts them after getting Peaches to stop reading her diary. She asks them to stay out of her life.  Later, Peaches apologizes and Laura tells her what she thinks is the real reason Brad left. It turns out that Laura has been putting her parent‚Äôs wishes first and Brad got tired of seeing it. Even when it came to deciding their wedding song, Laura chose the one her parents wanted. Brad asked her so many times to create boundaries with her parents but she refused to do it. Laura is worried she lost the love of her life because she couldn‚Äôt stand up to her parents and Peaches tries to encourage her.  The following morning, Laura‚Äôs parents show up and apologize for everything. They agree that they played a big role in her failed wedding and promise to do better. After saying everything she has been keeping down for years, Laura starts setting boundaries with her parents. Her dad calls Brad and personally apologizes and promises to stop interfering with their lives.  Things are also getting better with Javier and Elena. He advises her to stop trying to protect everyone the same way she did with him. He points out that she doesn‚Äôt get to make decisions for him or Ruby. Elena hears Javier‚Äôs advice and apologizes to Ruby but they still don‚Äôt make up. Elena is worried that Ruby‚Äôs feelings for Isla are clouding her judgement.  On the other side of the Island, Isla shows Ruby her mermaid form and invites her to choose to be a mermaid as well; it is the only way they can be together forever.  After solving her problem with her parents, Laura says goodbye to Peaches and is surprised to see Brad arrive on the Island. Her parents leave and Laura stays behind to spend time with Brad.  As they see off the guests, Elena asks Ruby about her wedding to her husband but it seems Ruby is having a hard time remembering her past life. This worries Elena.  The Episode Review  Elena is protective for a reason but Javier is right, it is not her decision to make. Ruby is a grown woman and can figure things out on her own, if she needs help, she will ask. I am glad Javier called out Elena on this habit. Hopefully, they can get back together and solve their problems together in the future.  I am eager to see what Ruby will decide. I don‚Äôt think Isla means well, I mean why would she wipe away Ruby‚Äôs memories?  As for the guest, I am glad she set her boundaries and got her happy ending. With parents like that, she deserves a bit of time away from them!  Previous Episode Next Episode Expect A Full Season Write-Up When This Season Concludes!

Hans Eggstein was feeling out of place. As ‚Äúthe only white boy at the wedding,‚Äù as he described it, the restaurant manager was nervous.  He wondered if he‚Äôd made a mistake taking time off from his job at Philly‚Äôs famed Le Bec-Fin to accept a waiter‚Äôs invitation to a wedding in Casablanca, especially after a back-firing car sent him diving to the ground in a crowded bazaar shortly following his arrival. Then he saw Samira Mountassir.  ‚ÄúShe was so beautiful in her kaftan and jewelry,‚Äù Eggstein told Billy Penn. ‚ÄúShe looked like a princess.‚Äù  Mountassir (now Eggstein) recalls being similarly struck. ‚ÄúI felt comfortable right away around him,‚Äù she said of their brief interaction at the wedding. ‚ÄúI even held his hand on our first date,‚Äù in defiance of her conservative upbringing.  Fast forward 17 years, and the duo are now proprietors of Chez Hansi on the 1600 block of South Street.  The spot underwent a few changes since opening last April before settling into a quaint BYO with 24 seats across a main floor and lower level. Dishes include spaetzle-and-mushroom covered schnitzels, fragrant couscous-based tajines, and plenty of pastries, both savory and sweet.  It‚Äôs a harmonious blend of the couple‚Äôs respective European and North African backgrounds, and a realization of a plan set in motion during their earliest conversations.  Chez Hansi‚Äôs vegetable tajine, a bright rendition of the classic Moroccan dish. (Kimberly Paynter/WHYY)  Obstacles along the way  Wanting to respect local customs, then 55-year-old Hans approached Samira‚Äôs family the day after the wedding in Morocco to seek out her mother‚Äôs approval for a date, which was promptly denied. Undeterred, he returned two days later, and then two days after that. The third time proved to be the charm.  Together at last, the two discovered a language barrier, with Samira speaking only a little English and Hans even less French.  ‚ÄúI remember we were talking about preparing couscous, and I was [struggling] to explain,‚Äù Samira said of their first date. ‚ÄúBut we got there, no problem. We made it.‚Äù  They quickly bonded over their shared culinary interests and backgrounds. Samira, who had honed her baking skills in her uncle‚Äôs bakery, had grown up with a passion for cooking; experimenting in the kitchen from an early age and by high school regularly preparing meals for her mother and five siblings. She had settled on an accounting diploma after narrowly missing the application deadline for restaurant school.  Hans had grown up in his parents‚Äô traditional German pub in Stuttgart, where he later went to restaurant school before moving to Philadelphia in 1974 and eventually becoming a manager at Georges Perrier‚Äôs Center City fine dining gem.  Over the next few days, Samira guided Hans across Casablanca, exploring the cafes and restaurants on Boulevard d‚ÄôAnfa and the local bazaars. They served as inspiration for the pair‚Äôs future cafe, which even by that early point had become a shared assumption.  With his time in Casablanca coming to an end and the two realizing how difficult it was to say goodbye ‚Äì ‚ÄúI think I cried in the airport,‚Äù said Samira ‚Äì they made plans for Hans to return several times over the next few months.  Chez Hansi‚Äôs cr√®me br√ªl√©e. (Kimberly Paynter/WHYY)  A little over a year after first meeting, the Eggsteins were married in Casablanca in 2007, with a plan to move to Germany once Samira‚Äôs paperwork was processed.  But the German bureaucratic system was ‚Äúoverwhelming‚Äù, Hans said, proving ‚Äútoo long and with too many steps.‚Äù He demoted himself to waiter to make it easier to continue seeing Samira. ‚ÄúBeing a manager was too much work to step away from,‚Äù Hans explained. ‚ÄúSo, I stepped down.‚Äù  ‚ÄúFor three years he was coming to visit me in Casablanca,‚Äù said Samira. ‚ÄúBut it wasn‚Äôt enough.‚Äù  Frustrated by the lack of progress, the Eggsteins changed their plans and decided to move to the U.S. They applied for Samira‚Äôs green card and, within three months, had settled in Philadelphia, where Hans found her a job as a runner at Le Bec-Fin.  ‚ÄúIt was like restaurant school,‚Äù Samira said of the experience. ‚ÄúI learned how to set up the table, how to serve, how to clean up. I loved it.‚Äù  ‚ÄòA rollercoaster ride‚Äô  Samira moved on to other establishments, working at the Water Works, Chestnut Hill Hotel, White Dog Caf√©, and Germantown‚Äôs Paris Bistro, where she went from waitressing to becoming assistant manager. Throughout, the couple kept the vision of opening their own cafe.  ‚ÄúWe had no money, but the dream was there,‚Äù said Hans. ‚ÄúSo, we started very slowly, doing catering on our days off.‚Äù  Tarte au citron at Chez Hansi on a table outside the South Street West BYOB. (Kimberly Paynter/WHYY)  They set up Anfa Catering in 2016, working out of a commissary in University City on a menu of sauerkraut, veggie burgers, and salads. The service ran for a year and made no profit.  Hans was forced to retire from his day job due to health reasons. Samira went back to waitressing at Bistro la Baia on Lombard. On his way to pick Samira up one evening, Hans noticed a ‚Äúfor rent‚Äù sign in the window of 1610 South St., a small storefront that was previously home to Pumpkin Market.  Samira agreed the space was ‚Äúvery cute,‚Äù and right in line with their vision of a neighborhood caf√© specializing in coffee, baguettes, and pastries.  Chez Hansi opened quietly in April of 2022 ‚Äî ‚ÄúI have no money for advertising,‚Äù said Hans. It was a rocky start, the Eggsteins struggling to secure the regular clientele that their idea of an early morning cafe depended on.  Samira found herself overworked, baking at night, setting up at Hansi in the morning before rushing off to her waitressing job, while Hans lamented the effort and trays of baked goods going to waste daily. Realizing the concept wasn‚Äôt working, the couple called an emergency meeting one late summer evening.  ‚ÄúWe just closed the [restaurant] doors and had a brainstorm,‚Äù Samira said of the night a new menu was created and the decision taken to run Chez Hansi as a dinner spot, with dishes inspired by German and Moroccan cuisine, or as Hans describes it, ‚Äúgood home cooking.‚Äù  Eight months in, the reinvention seems to be working.  The labor is evenly split ‚Äî the two shop daily for ingredients together, Samira bakes and serves customers while Hans cooks, and join forces for cleaning duties at the end of the night. The menu rotates weekly according to marketplace availability and Hans‚Äô mood, with some staple dishes like the jaegerschnitzel, and a tajine that alternates between vegetarian and slow-braised lamb. Entrees hover between $20 and $30.  Samira also makes weekly additions to the pastry menu, like a black forest cake she added to the usual lineup of lemon tart, chocolate mousse, tiramisu, and cr√®me brul√©e, alongside the savory poultry-nut-and-berries bastillas. ‚ÄúSamira‚Äôs pastries are unbelievable,‚Äù beamed Hans.  Now settling into a routine, the Eggsteins are hoping to establish more of a presence in the community. They‚Äôre considering live jazz nights and a special cake promotion for Bastille Day.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still a rollercoaster ride. One day you think ‚ÄúI made it‚Äù because it was busy, and then the next no business,‚Äù said Hans. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm really happy with what we‚Äôre doing here.‚Äù  ‚ÄúIt took too long,‚Äù Samira said, ‚ÄúBut it makes you happy when people come and enjoy themselves and leave with a smile. It‚Äôs worth it.‚Äù  1611 South Street | 5 to 9 p.m. Tuesday-Saturday (closed Tuesday May 30) | (267) 455-0670

By Michelle Crowe  Monique Lhuillier for The Gold Coast Room at The Drake.  It‚Äôs going to be a whirl of weddings all summer long and guests are pulling out all the stops. This is the time to pull the vintage Yves Saint Laurent out of the closet, take the jewelry out of the vault, and test all shoes for danceability. Why? Because brides just want to have fun and they‚Äôre bringing their nearest and dearest along for the ride.  Zimmerman for a beach wedding.  It feels like every ballroom and boat has been refreshed over the last few years. Floral designers are doing dazzling work, transforming already beautiful spaces into true visions. Even coffee service and late-night snacks have been given an upgrade as they might now arrive via an adorable Italian truck that‚Äôs been converted to food cart.  Floral Oscar de la Renta for a garden party.  With so much fun to be had against these photogenic backdrops, each wedding is a chance to celebrate the unity of people we love and to stage epic photos and memorialize the moment.  Christian Siriano ombre with a cape for a creative venue.  The recent wedding of Sophia Richie and Elliot Grainge was documented in real time across social networks with millions around the world reacting to the looks. Lots of summer 2023 weddings will be taking their cues from this and encouraging guests to get in on the posting fun. Adding to your feed won‚Äôt be considered upstaging the bride. It will be helping the algorithm.  Lela Rose for the country club.  All of this is to say that if your dressing room is not home to fabulous vintage or something smashing in your dressing room, it‚Äôs time to hit the shops. Designers are meeting the moment with exquisite dresses that look dreamy, travel well, and will become treasured pieces in your collection forever. See you on the dance floor.

Warm weather, a glass of something fizzy and full on glam ‚Äì that's right, it's wedding season. But while the gorgeous photos from Jamie Laing and Sophie Habboo's Spanish nuptials nuptials last weekend gave us feel good vibes, planning such a monumental life event can be seriously stressful.  That's something you might know only too well if it's your best mate getting ready to say 'I do'. Worries about dress dramas, guest lists and hair disasters are enough to turn any beautiful bride into a seething hot mess, venting at her friends as she struggles to keep in control!  It‚Äôs every bridesmaid‚Äôs worst nightmare - dealing with the Bridezilla. Because regardless of how well you think you know your closest mate, you can never predict how the pressure of the fast-approaching nuptials will make her feel and act.  If you're a bridesmaid, or even just as a member of her support squad, your role isn‚Äôt simply to plan her the best hen party of all time. You‚Äôre there for her during every step of the way and of course, walk beside them (in person and/or emotionally) on their big day. So, how do you deal with a bride-to-be who‚Äôs letting the prospect of what should be the happiest day of their life transform them from super chill to a seething ball of stress?  (Image: Nearly Weds Podcast/Instagram)  Lisa Forde, wedding expert and founder of leading stationery company Tree of Hearts, is on hand with her top tips.  ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs your sister or childhood BF, you want what‚Äôs best for your bride-to-be, but it can often be really tricky knowing how to do this sensitively,‚Äù Lisa explains. ‚ÄúYou have your own life, which understandably doesn‚Äôt revolve around this upcoming wedding. But you‚Äôve been given and accepted a very important role and need to act accordingly to prevent any major friendship fallouts.‚Äù  RULE 1: Keep calm and carry on  ‚ÄúIn true British style, you need to stay calm and carry on. Be patient with your bride - even if you want to strangle her - and try to give her the benefit of the doubt when she‚Äôs having a Bridezilla moment.‚Äù  (Image: Getty Images)  RULE 2: Don‚Äôt take it personally  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not you - it‚Äôs her! Sometimes wedding planning brings out the worst in people, the bride may snap and bark orders, and it‚Äôs easy to get offended and wonder if you‚Äôve done something wrong. Try not to get upset about it, it‚Äôs almost certainly not your fault, It's probably not you the bride-to-be is mad at.‚Äù  RULE 3: Talk to her  ‚ÄúWedding planning is an incredibly stressful time, and stress can make people behave in ways they normally wouldn‚Äôt. If your bestie strays toward the Bridezilla territory, maybe consider letting her know, she may not even realise that she‚Äôs turning nasty.‚Äù  (Image: Getty Images)  RULE 4: Plan something away from wedding prep  Maybe it‚Äôs worth planning a day out to distract the bride-to-be from her wedding planning duties and remind you of the bestie she once was. Maybe invite the rest of the bridal party but explain it is a wedding-planning free zone. Let her take her hair down and relax.  RULE 5: Step away‚Ä¶  ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs all getting too much and impacting your own life and mental health, don‚Äôt be afraid to remove yourself from the situation. You need to give your reasons and be clear so they are able to understand. It might be an emotional conversation, but try to remain confident in your decision and remember why you have made it.‚Äù  READ MORE:

Sign up to our newsletter for daily updates and breaking news delivered direct to your inbox  Plans have been submitted to convert a historic manor house near Slough into a hotel and wedding venue. The proposed conversion of Ditton Manor House would see the main building, chapel and granary adapted into the flexible venue, along with the north, east and south gatehouses.  The brief proposal visible on Slough Council's planning portal show developers plan to build a bar, restaurant and spa. The Local Democracy Service reported earlier this month the manor house itself would be a 33-bed hotel, while a two-storey block adjacent would facilitate an extra 99 rooms.  Ditton Park belonged to the crown under the reign on Elizabeth I, before being passed on to Ralph Montagu, 1st Duke of Montagu. The previous house on the site was taken down after being damaged by a fire in 1812, which eventually led to the construction of the house on show today.  READ MORE: Interactive map shows the Berkshire banks set to close in 2023  Built in a romantic and gothic architectural style, it features turrets and crenelations which provide it a stark identity. For much of the 19th century it was home to the Duchess of Buccleuch who was a very close friend to Queen Victoria.  Since then, more outbuildings were constructed and the land was used for a variety of purposes including radar research and a compass observatory.  The estate owners say they have to change tactics as the site was mainly used for 8-hour conferences, but has seen small demand ever since the Covid-19 pandemic.  The planning statement reads: ‚ÄúThe result of the pandemic and changing work styles has increased the demand for 24-hour conferencing which is not currently possible at the site as there are no bedroom facilities. To meet this demand, significant refurbishment and additional development is required to provide a product geared to market demand; hotel bedrooms, leisure facilities, restaurant and bar, conferencing, and weddings.‚Äù  Planning officers are yet to decide on the application. 10 Tips To Plan Your Intimate Microwedding (Because Small Doesn't Always Mean Easy)  Whether this is your first wedding or fifth (we're not judging), you may be looking at making it a small affair ‚Äî not so small you elope with your besties, but something like a 50-person wedding. Microweddings are becoming more and more popular since the dawn of Covid-19, and we've got the deets on what these mini-weddings entail (and trust us, while the budget is smaller, you should still expect to spend some big money).  In case you haven't heard this term yet, a microwedding is a wedding with 50 people or fewer in attendance. You're still following the basic wedding traditions, but you're doing them on a smaller scale. If you're not looking for the secrecy of an elopement, but you don't want hundreds of guests, this is the direction you want to take. You can still do the walk down the aisle, the seated buffet dinner, and all that jazz. You're just doing it with fewer people on the guest list.  While the guest list may be smaller, there are still some things you'll want to invest in, as well as some things that may pose a challenge when it comes to preparations. We're going to look at some of the things that are integral to making this smaller wedding happen, from the money you'll spend to the time you'll want to invest.

Ahead of the highly anticipated final of the Indian Premier League 2023 (IPL 2023), an interesting development has emerged. Ruturaj Gaikwad, the opening batter for the Chennai Super Kings (CSK), is scheduled to tie the knot in the initial week of June.  The CSK team is set to face the defending champions, Gujarat Titans (GT), in the ultimate showdown of the T20 league on May 28 at the magnificent Narendra Modi Stadium.  Gaikwad, who was among the standby players for the World Test Championship (WTC) 2023 final, will no longer be joining the team in their journey to London.  As per media reports, the Mumbai and Rajasthan Royals batter Yashasvi Jaiswal is expected to take Gaikwad‚Äôs place.  Gaikwad has personally informed the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) about his wedding plans on either June 3 or 4, making it impossible for him to accompany the team to the United Kingdom for the WTC final.  Yashasvi Jaiswal likely to shift focus on red ball practice  BCCI selectors have allegedly approached Yashasvi Jaiswal, urging him to shift his focus to practising with the red ball. This suggests that Jaiswal is likely to be named as the replacement for Ruturaj Gaikwad in the upcoming matches.  However, no official announcement has been made by the BCCI regarding this matter. It is anticipated that the board may disclose the finalized changes in the following week.  India squad gears up for WTC 2023 Final  The WTC 2023 Final is scheduled to take place at The Oval in London from June 7 to 11, featuring an intense clash between India and Australia. In preparation for the prestigious event, the Indian team is making its way to the United Kingdom in two separate groups.  The first group consists of players who have concluded their Indian Premier League (IPL) season and have already arrived in the UK. Among the notable names in this squad are Virat Kohli, Umesh Yadav, Shardul Thakur, Axar Patel, and several others.  These players have wasted no time and have commenced their practice sessions to acclimatize to the English conditions.  The second group, comprising players from the Gujarat Titans, Mumbai Indians, and Chennai Super Kings, who participated in the IPL, is expected to depart for the UK shortly.  India‚Äôs captain, Rohit Sharma, along with Ishan Kishan, is set to leave for London on May 28. Suryakumar Yadav will join them on May 30, accompanied by Mohammed Shami, Shubman Gill, and Ravindra Jadeja, who are involved in the IPL final on Sunday.
