Prince Harry wrote in his book he was left wondering if 'maybe Granny intervened'  Trending  Millions of their fans may have been hoping they would mark the special day with a message or new picture, but neither was released. It is possible Harry and Meghan marked their fifth wedding anniversary privately and in a quiet fashion with their two young children - Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet. The Duke and Duchess made two high-profile public appearances together in the US during the past week after being spotted in the crowd at an NBA basketball game in Los Angeles a few weeks ago. Last Monday, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex cemented their interest in their new community when they met with a local youth group in Santa Barbara.  Prince Harry and Meghan Markle married on May 19, 2018  The couple visited AHA! Santa Barbara "to learn first hand about this generation‚Äôs experiences with social media and societal pressures, and how it affects their mental well-being". Harry and Meghan were pictured taking part in a discussion with group members about the opportunities and risks social media can offer to young generations. On Tuesday evening, received the Ms Foundation's Women of Vision Award, recognising her "global advocacy to empower and advocate on behalf of women and girls". She was accompanied to the Ms Foundation for Women's 50th anniversary gala event in New York by Harry and her mother, Doria Ragland.  Prince Harry and Meghan Markle - a romantic timeline

Somebody Somewhere NMB NMP Season 2 Episode 5 Editor‚Äôs Rating 5 stars * * * * * ¬´ Previous Next ¬´ Previous Episode Next Episode ¬ª Photo: Marian Wyse/Marian Wyse  Joel! Sweet, sweet Joel! What have you done? It was only time before Somebody Somewhere put Joel and Sam‚Äôs friendship to the test, and that test begins right now with ‚ÄúNMB NMP.‚Äù It‚Äôs awful and I hate it, by which I mean it‚Äôs completely gutting and there aren‚Äôt enough tini-tinis in the world to make it okay. And this is only the beginning!  The episode, written by Rachel Axler and directed by Lennon Parham, wisely kicks off by reminding us how special Sam and Joel‚Äôs relationship is. They‚Äôre goofing off in the car, talking about their own dream weddings. Joel‚Äôs includes Sam singing Laura Branigan‚Äôs ‚Äô80s banger ‚ÄúGloria‚Äù while he walks down the aisle. Sam initially balks at the idea of attempting to take on the late icon ‚Äî she lives by a simple singing rule: ‚ÄúNo Barbra, no Judy, no Branigan‚Äù ‚Äî but the pull is too strong, and before long, we‚Äôre all calling Gloria. Although reluctant to even admit to having thought about her own wedding, Sam says she‚Äôd want to wear her mother‚Äôs wedding dress, and yes, she realizes there‚Äôs a real height discrepancy there. ‚ÄúMe, my mom‚Äôs dress, and my beaver walking down the aisle to meet the man of our dreams,‚Äù she tells Joel. This moment, paired with Joel and Sam meeting Fred and Tiffani at the tailor‚Äôs for their tuxedo fittings, is, I think, the reason people are so endeared to this show. They‚Äôre such authentic displays of friendship ‚Äî so warm and fun, and you just want to be around these people as long as possible. They‚Äôre also the perfect setup for the emotional gut punch of watching that friendship be put in danger. Am I being dramatic about this? I don‚Äôt care! The thought of Sam and Joel in a fight is keeping me up at night, okay?  At the tailor‚Äôs, Joel is a little coy about his plans for the day ‚Äî Sam‚Äôs looking for help baking Tricia a birthday cake ‚Äî and one weird FaceTime later, in which Joel‚Äôs face covers the entire screen (I‚Äôm still laughing about it, honestly, the perfect cover-up), we learn that he‚Äôs on a secret date with Brad Schraeder, n√©e SLS. Oh, this date, you guys! This date is so adorable. These two nerds are hanging out at a historical house in Manhattan, and they couldn‚Äôt be more excited about it. I never thought I‚Äôd find the sentence ‚ÄúI could listen to you talk about the Kansas-Nebraska Act all day‚Äù romantic, but here we are! Joel can‚Äôt help but plant a big ol‚Äô kiss on Brad, and friends, it looks like this relationship has gone legit. That‚Äôs exciting, of course, but the moment Brad asks Joel to have a meal at the Chef with him ‚Äî the place where Joel and Sam regularly grab breakfast ‚Äî you know this whole thing is about to blow up.  It doesn‚Äôt take long. When Sam shows up at the Chef waiting for Joel and the waiter says he has Joel‚Äôs windbreaker that he left there yesterday when he was in with ‚ÄúMr. Schraeder,‚Äù she knows exactly what‚Äôs going on. She leaves. Then, when Joel shows up and is informed that Sam left and has the windbreaker, he knows she knows. He probably is bracing himself a little bit for what he‚Äôs walking into when he goes to see Sam face-to-face, but there‚Äôs no way he‚Äôs totally prepared for Sam‚Äôs reaction. If looks could kill, my babies! Poor Joel tries to act casual, tossing in a ‚Äúguess the secret‚Äôs out‚Äù and trying to tell Sam that she‚Äôd actually really like Brad, but Sam wants exactly none of it. She‚Äôs so angry she can barely speak. All she musters is to tell Joel to take his windbreaker and leave. It‚Äôs rough. The camera lingers on Sam sitting alone in her kitchen, stewing as she tries to eat some of her takeout breakfast. What a sad little tableau.  Taken alone, it would be easy to decide that Sam‚Äôs overreacting, to say the very least. Sure, Joel shouldn‚Äôt keep secrets from his best friend, but in the grand scheme of things it‚Äôs not that big of a deal, and Sam should be happy that her friend has found someone. But the situation is more complicated than that. What Joel doesn‚Äôt know is that he is actually the second person Sam deeply trusts that, in the span of a few hours, she‚Äôs learned has kept something important a secret from her. And both for the same reason: They didn‚Äôt think Sam would be able to handle the news they had to share. From her reactions to both, it seems like maybe they were right. So, if Joel is one of those people Sam‚Äôs feeling betrayed by, who is the other? It‚Äôs Sam‚Äôs late sister Holly.  It‚Äôs a real shame because Sam and Tricia have never gotten along better and it all goes to shit pretty quickly ‚Äî much like the cake Sam tries to bake for Tricia‚Äôs 47th birthday. Sam tells Joel that she wants to make her sister a funeral cake like they used to have as kids because it‚Äôs Tricia‚Äôs first birthday without Rick and Shannon is off at school. She calls it ‚Äúa tender gesture,‚Äù and she‚Äôs not wrong. It‚Äôs thoughtful and 100 percent the thought that counts here because Sam is a terrible baker. She knows it and I applaud her bravery for going in anyway. The confidence she has to just wing it is a thing to behold. The recipe calls for room-temperature butter, and she decides to put it in the microwave instead. She needs to add vegetable oil, and this woman just sprays some nonstick spray into the bowl instead of using the vegetable oil right in front of her. ‚ÄúThat should be good,‚Äù she says. Someone get Bridget Everett a cooking show and someone do it soon.  The thing is, Tricia is still grateful for Sam trying to make the day special, even if the cake turns out like, as Sam calls it, ‚Äúa big hot dump.‚Äù After the sisters share a few laughs about Tricia‚Äôs fancy new fridge and Sam‚Äôs terrible, somehow very wet cake ‚Äî ‚ÄúWell, wet is never bad. Oh, you should put that on a pillow.‚Äù ‚Äî Tricia thanks her sister for making an effort and keeping this day light. She admits she‚Äôs really been dreading her 47th birthday since it‚Äôs the same age Holly was when she was diagnosed with cancer. Sam thinks Tricia‚Äôs confused, Holly was 48, but it doesn‚Äôt take long for Sam to realize she‚Äôs the confused one. This escalates quickly. Tricia tries to explain that Holly kept her diagnosis a secret from Sam because she was trying to protect her ‚Äî she didn‚Äôt think Sam could handle it and she didn‚Äôt want to put her through it. Tricia thought keeping that information from her was wrong, but it was Holly‚Äôs choice. Sam is so upset, and as much as these two have pretended not to really understand one another, ooohh, buddy, does Tricia get Sam. She knows that Sam wants to leave, and she‚Äôs right. She tries to stop her, pleading with Sam not to go, not to cut her out because that‚Äôs what she always does. When someone makes ‚Äúa tiny mistake,‚Äù she cuts them out. ‚ÄúYou cut people out, Sam,‚Äù she yells, almost heartbroken. ‚ÄúYou cannot keep doing that; there won‚Äôt be anyone left.‚Äù And still, Sam goes, and Tricia‚Äôs left all alone crying over the sink. It‚Äôs wild how fast this show can move from laugh-out-loud funny to achingly real and never miss a beat. The buildup to Sam storming out is so deftly done, and if people aren‚Äôt winning awards for this scene alone, what are we even doing here?  Back at home, Sam looks at all the memories of Holly that surround her ‚Äî her initials scratched in the piano ‚Äî until she sits down and cries. Bridget Everett in this moment, you guys! Similarly to that scene in the premiere when Sam cries thinking about her dad as she cleans the barn, the camera just lets Everett do her thing here. Eventually, Sam takes off Holly‚Äôs necklaces, and the next morning we see that she decided to sleep on the couch again instead of in Holly‚Äôs bed. She‚Äôs cutting her out, just like Tricia said she would, just like she‚Äôs trying to do to Joel. Here‚Äôs hoping Sam breaks her habit before it‚Äôs too late.  Tender Moments  ‚Ä¢When Sam first comes home from the big fight with Tricia, Darlene is there to give Sam her cassette from her last vocal lesson. Sam apologizes for running out, but there‚Äôs no need to apologize to this angel! Darlene gets it: ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it strange, something that brings us so much joy can be almost too much to bear?‚Äù Sam gives her a long hug, you can tell Sam really needs it. ‚ÄúKeep singing, Sam. We need you,‚Äù Darlene says as she goes. Give this woman Teacher of the Year or something!  ‚Ä¢ Tricia goes to a local party-rental store to start reserving items for Fred and Susan‚Äôs wedding, but the owner, Heather, refuses her business. At first, Tricia assumes Heather has an issue with Fred and immediately defends him and that‚Äôs called growth, baby. But Heather doesn‚Äôt know Fred ‚Äî she does know, however, that Charity told her all about how Tricia tried to hook up with Coop. After Tricia‚Äôs done cackling at the absurdity of Charity trying to tarnish her name, she calls Charity a skank and makes a joke about her spreading rumors and her legs, and I‚Äôm so glad not all of old Tricia is gone.  ‚Ä¢ As someone whose college pregame playlist included Laura Branigan‚Äôs ‚ÄúGloria‚Äù in steady rotation, I was thrilled to see it get a shout-out here. Will Somebody Somewhere do for Laura Branigan what Stranger Things did for Kate Bush? I sure hope so.  ‚Ä¢ Petition for Joel and Brad to double-date with Leslie Knope and Ben Wyatt.  ‚Ä¢ Drunk on her birthday and ignoring calls and texts from Rick, Tricia decides to tag Charity in a ‚ÄúLying Cunt‚Äù pillow Instagram post. It‚Äôs about time, Tricia.  ‚Ä¢ Tricia‚Äôs fancy refrigerator can also play music, and her choice to dance alone in her kitchen to Joan Armatrading‚Äôs ‚ÄúShow Some Emotion‚Äù is perfect.  ‚Ä¢ Sam thinks Tricia should name her new pillow company ‚ÄúCharity Cases,‚Äù and I second that.  ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúSick! Oh, my god, I can‚Äôt believe I said ‚Äòsick.‚Äô‚Äù

For a summer wedding, you may want to consider lehenga hues that are refreshing, vibrant, and complement the warm weather. Here are 10 lehenga colours that are perfect for a summer wedding:Powder Blue: A soft and delicate shade of blue that brings a cool and serene vibe to your summer wedding look.Mint Green: A light and refreshing green shade that adds a touch of elegance and freshness to your ensemble.Coral: A vibrant and energetic hue that reflects the lively spirit of summer, perfect for making a statement.Peach: A soft and warm colour that exudes a subtle charm and complements various skin tones.Sunshine Yellow: A bright and cheerful shade that instantly uplifts your mood and adds a pop of colour to your attire.Lavender: A soothing and ethereal hue that brings a sense of tranquility and elegance to your summer wedding look.Blush Pink: A romantic and feminine colour that enhances your natural glow and creates a soft and graceful appearance.Aqua Blue: A refreshing and vibrant shade of blue that evokes a tropical vibe and stands out beautifully in the summer sunlight.Pastel Orange: A muted and light shade of orange that adds a touch of warmth and complements the summer ambiance.Ivory: A timeless and elegant colour that radiates sophistication and pairs well with intricate embellishments and embroidery.Remember, while choosing a lehenga colour for a summer wedding, it's essential to consider your skin tone, personal style, and the overall theme of the event. These colour suggestions can serve as a starting point to explore various shades that resonate with your preferences and create a stunning summer wedding look.

Governor attends Phuket Baba Wedding  PHUKET: Narong Woonciew, the Governor of Phuket province, and Bunwandee Woonciew, the Governor‚Äôs wife and President of Phuket Red Cross, were among the honored guests at today‚Äôs (May 21) events held as part of the annual Chinese Weddings in Phuket.  cultureChinese  By The Phuket News  Sunday 21 May 2023, 03:49PM  Governor Narong and his spouse, Bunwandee, participated in the traditional Peranakan rituals at the Hongyok Family House (also known as Ang Mo Lao Hongyok, Baan Hongyok, or just Hongyok Mansion) on Thepkrasattri Rd in Phuket Town.  Five couples performed their marriage rites at Baan Hongyok today (May 21), contributing to the preservation and promotion of the old traditions of Peranakan, or Straits Chinese.  This term refers to the descendants of the early waves of Southern Chinese immigrants to Southeast Asia, who initially settled in the British Colonial-ruled ports in the Malay Peninsula and later migrated to other destinations, such as Phuket.  The traditional Chinese Wedding events today also featured a street procession along Thepkrasattri Rd. The participants, adorned in vintage attire, walked from the Hongyok Mansion to the Thai Hua Museum, which was Phuket‚Äôs first school offering classes in Hokkien Chinese.  "It promotes soft power and local culture as we hope the pictures from the event will become viral social media content worldwide, thereby advancing cultural tourism and supporting our goal of having Peranakan costumes recognized as world heritage," stated the Phuket Provincial Office of the PR Department of Thailand.  As announced earlier this week, the open for public Phuket Peranakan Festival will be held in Phuket Town from June 23-25 to celebrate the island‚Äôs and the city‚Äôs unique Chinese heritage. Read more here.  For more photos from the May 21 events in Phuket Town, click here.

Indian weddings comprise several traditional rituals. Priests or pandits conduct Hindu weddings as per the religious rituals. They chant different mantras and make the brides and grooms take the wedding vows. The significance of these mantras and religious rituals certainly hold importance since time immemorial.  The brides and grooms take seven wedding vows during the puja. Each of the vows has its own significance.  Here we bring you a video of a Hindu wedding that has recently stormed the internet. The video will certainly leave you stunned and rolling on the floors, laughing.  As seen in the video, a pandit along with others is sitting on the wedding mandap. The bride is also seen sitting close to the ‚ÄòHavan kund‚Äô.    However, instead of chanting the shlokas or mantras, the pandit starts singing, ‚ÄúSaath Rahenge, Saat Janam Tak... Aao Yeh Khayen Kasam‚Ä¶(Let‚Äôs take an oath that we will live together for seven births)‚Äù  As the pandit completes the lyrics, another person is heard repeating the same line with music playing in the background.  Later, the pandit says, ‚ÄúWhen he saw her for the first time, Vinayak took an oath. Do you know which oath he took?‚Äù  ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡•á‡§ü ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§®‡§è ‡§™‡§Ç‡§°‡§ø‡§§ ‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§Ü ‡§ö‡•Å‡§ï‡•á ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇ pic.twitter.com/JA9yspSflp ‚Äî Hasna Zaroori Hai üáÆüá≥ (@HasnaZarooriHai) May 10, 2023  The pandit continues, ‚ÄúTumhe Apna Banane Ki Kasam, Khai Hai, Khai Hai‚Ä¶ Haan Khai Hai‚Ä¶‚Äù This left the relatives, guests, friends and all others at the wedding cheering loud.  Again, the unseen person starts repeating the lyrics.  As the camera pans towards the guests witnessing the wedding, a few among them start singing the lyrics in chorus.  The pandit again continues, when Nandini saw him (Vinayak) for the first time, she also developed a feeling.  Describing her feelings, the Pandit says, ‚ÄúTu mera hai sanam, tu hi mera humdum, tere saang jeena aab saaton janam.‚Äù  This time, a girl joined the man and starts repeating the lyrics of the song.    The video shared on Twitter by Hasna Zaroori Hai has gone viral on social media triggering a laugh riot among users.

Rajkot: For Vijay Bambhaniya and Sheeta Baraiya of Mahuva taluka in Bhavnagar, this Saturday will be a red letter day in their lives not just for their wedding but the intense drama it unfolded in its wake.Their wedding day in Katpar village of Mahuva taluka was almost on the brink of collapse with members of both families engaging in fisticuffs over a petty incident on Saturday, saved only by the police which intervened and got it solemnized late on Saturday.The police are now investigating into the violence, even as 10 persons ‚Äî five from groom‚Äôs side and five of the bride‚Äôs ‚Äî were booked for assault and threatening by the Mahuva police following cross-complaints by both parties.A few family members from both sides are also recuperating in private hospitals.According to the police, both the bride and groom are from the same village. As per tradition, the groom's family and the bride‚Äôs family take out a procession in the village ahead of the marriage.While both the sides were doing the rounds on Saturday, the groom‚Äôs family and that of the bride‚Äôs came face to face near Hanuman Chowk in the village. Suddenly, someone dancing to DJ music sprayed foam as part of celebration which hit Vijay, the groom, on his face.This triggered a verbal altercation between the two sides. Soon, it turned ugly with revellers resorting to physical assaults on one another.One of the complainants from the bride's side Vipul Dhaya , stated that five people from the groom‚Äôs side beat up his father following the foam-spraying incident. When others tried to intervene, a group of people attacked the groom‚Äôs relative Puja Bambhaniya and others. Bambhaniya later lodged a complaint against five persons with Mahuva police station.Based on the two cross-complaints filed, police booked 10 persons for assault and intimidation.

A man was found dead along the Lusignan access road, East Coast Demerara on Saturday.  He was seen moments before at a wedding, mere streets away.  Police identified the deceased as Choorandan Chaitram called ‚ÄòReid‚Äô, a 41-year-old construction worker also of Lusignan.  The Police statement disclosed that Chaitram left home at about 16:00 hrs to attend a wedding at Lusignan Grass Field.  At about 03:50 hrs, Police ranks responded to a 911 call that a body of a male was seen lying on the Lusignan access road.  When Police arrived at the scene, they saw the body lying on the road, about two streets from the wedding, in a pool of what appeared to be blood.  ‚ÄúHis body was examined, and a wound about three inches was seen on his throat,‚Äù the Police statement noted.  Chaitram‚Äôs body was identified by his brother. Several persons were questioned, and certain information was received, Police said.

The mother, her son and the daughter in law.  Love, marriage rituals, and a wedding theft  Jonathan Smyth looks at some old marriage customs and the theft of clothes in Ballyjamesduff to attend a wedding in his latest Times Past column...  Frank ‚ÄòOl blue eye‚Äô Sinatra, sang manys the love song and one of his favourites was ‚ÄòLove and Marriage‚Äô, with its rhyming lyrics: 'Love and marriage, love, and marriage, Go together like a horse and carriage. This I tell ya, brother, you can't have one without the other', and so forth.  A myriad of marriage customs are found all over the world, and have the most unlikely of origins and many more that are purely an Irish invention.  In days gone by, carrying his bride across the threshold, was for the man, as old a custom as could be found anywhere in the world. Who doesn‚Äôt remember the John Wayne flick, ‚ÄòThe Quiet Man‚Äô where he carries the feisty Maureen O‚ÄôHara through the front door of their new home. Of course, a similar scene is repeated in countless films and novels. The tradition has an unlikely beginning and can be traced back to the ancient world of the Romans where it was a less than pleasant activity associated with the cruelty of the Roman soldiers who took women captive before carrying them over the threshold. These days, the custom is no longer as popular amongst newly married couples.  The Claddagh ring  Walt Disney the great movie-making owner of Disney Studios, and his wife, both wore matching claddagh rings to symbolise their undying love. However, the Irish Claddagh ring is no ordinary piece of jewellery and recently, it was explained to me that there are three positions that the rings can be worn that will show a person's status, whether they be single, searching for love, engaged or married. When worn on the left hand with the heart facing outwards, it symbolises that the person is engaged. Whereas, if the heart is facing inwards, then that signifies they are married. But if the ring is placed on the right hand with the heart facing out, it means that the person is single and searching for love.  Similarly, if you saw the ring on the right hand with the heart turned inwards, it means the individual is in a committed relationship.  Child of Prague  The Child of Prague is considered to be sacred by many and a tradition began where the figure was placed outside on the evening before a wedding to stop rain from falling on the big day, and to persuade some sun to shine. When Pierce Brosnan, the Navan-born James Bond actor, married his bride Keely Shaye Smith at Ballintubber Abbey, Co Mayo, he wanted to make certain that there‚Äôd be no downpour bucketing down to ruin the reception later at Ashford Castle. On the previous evening, he slipped out of the hotel in the middle of the night to place the Child of Prague in a bush beside Ashford Castle.  The white dress  Did you know that the trend for white wedding dresses was begun by England‚Äôs Queen Victoria who they say, wanted to show-off the white lace she was wearing when she married Prince Albert.  In the old days, a groom gave his bride a silver coin to symbolise the equal sharing of his wealth with her. Quite often parents passed a coin on to the eldest son. In some cases nowadays, partners exchange coins and, if the metal should clink together, then that meant a lot of luck was to come their way. The exchange was accompanied by the words ‚ÄòI give this as a token of all I possess‚Äô.  The custom of the coin has its origin in the ancient practice of providing a marriage dowry. But of course, it is not all about money.  Somebody once asked the married American poet Dorothy Parker: "What makes you think you‚Äôve got the perfect husband?"  She replied: "Well he remembers my birthday but forgets my age!" Now that is sound advice indeed.  Stolen wedding ‚Äòduds‚Äô  A wedding wouldn‚Äôt be the same without a new outfit to wear for the occasion. According to this paper, on April 6, 1854, on the day before a wedding, Rose Molloy was charged with going in to Miss Gibson, of Ballyjamesduff, on false pretences to get herself expensive clothes, which she made out were for Miss Hogg from Fintervin, and to convince the shopkeeper she produced ‚Äòan order in writing‚Äô which she said came from Miss Hogg, but the letter was in reality a forgery. Afterwards, Molloy was swiftly arrested.  Having acted like a total gombeen, she told the police she needed new clothes to wear at her brother's wedding and that, given the chance, would have paid back Miss Gibson. In any case, Miss Gibson was repaid and thankfully ‚Äòsustained no loss from the transaction‚Äô.  In addition to being compensated, Miss Gibson and her solicitor, Mr Tully, attested to the previous good character of Rose Molloy, while Mr Knipe was certain that if his client pleaded guilty, she‚Äôd be let off and ‚Äòset free‚Äô.  Miss Molloy had the option of paying a 20-shilling fine or spending a fortnight behind bars. The fine we are told was promptly paid.  Advice  In 1853, there were books full of advice to help you get yourself ready for marriage, and for the couples who had the money to buy the first four copies of 'The Family Treasury,' they would be set back by 2d. per edition. There were many tips to help the young couples to know what to expect on the day itself whether they be ‚ÄòDissenter, Catholic, or Quaker'.  And for any runaway partners, there was choice advice on how to get married in Gretna Green, which offered some consolation to runaway lovebirds.  The other day I saw a bumper sticker with these heart-warming words emblazoned across it: ‚ÄòNo love is greater than the love of an Irish mother‚Äô. However, there are also the countless mother-in-law jokes from the other side of the coin. Priyanka Chopra, who got married to Nick Jonas in 2018 at a grand wedding in Umaid Bhawan in Jodhpur, spoke about why she went for a grand affair.  When asked why did she want her wedding with Nick Jonas to be so big, the actress replied that her wedding was only big in scale but still very intimate. She further told CNN, "Because I never said I was subtle. Everything I do is big. I am a bold person.‚Äù Priyanka also said that only 110 people were attending the wedding who were very close to her and Nick and they kept it very intimate. The actress concluded by saying, ‚ÄúBut I wanted to get married in a palace, with a 75-foot train, why not?"  Priyanka Chopra is joining hands with renowned Hollywood stars John Cena and Idris Elba for Amazon Studios' Heads Of State, which was officially announced in April 2023.  The project, which is touted to be an action thriller, is directed by Ilya Naishuller. Heads Of State is jointly produced by Peter Safran and John Rickard, for Safran Company. Apart from this, she was recently seen in Citadel and Love Again. She will also be returning to Bollywood with Farhan Akhtar‚Äôs Jee Le Zaraa alongside Katrina Kaif and Alia Bhatt.  The actor was recently busy touring the world for her shows Citadel and Love Aagain.

The Project's Hamish Macdonald married his long-term partner Jacob Fitzroy this weekend.  His Project co-hosts shared the news on Sunday's show, along with a first-look at photos of the couple.  Macdonald wore a traditional kilt to walk down the aisle, while his new husband Jacob Fitzroy wore a classic black tuxedo and white bowtie.  Co-host Georgie Tunny announced the news, saying: "There has been a wedding in The Project family this weekend; our very own Hamish Macdonald and his longtime partner Jacob.  "Don't they just both look stupidly handsome and so gorgeous? We are so thrilled for them. They could not look more in love, look at them... they are so beyond beautiful and I just hope they had the most magical day."  Image: Channel 10.

‚Äî Sana Jamal  The advent of the Internet, the emergence of new-age technologies and evolving educational system have fuelled the rise of unconventional career options. Gone are the days when an engineer and a doctor were the only coveted career options available to the youth. Today, even your favourite pastime can be turned into a full-time vocation. Some of these unconventional career options are given below:  Image Consultant  An image consultant is a professional who manages the image and its elements, such as appearance, behaviour and communication of individuals and companies. It involves an understanding of who the client is, their personal and professional goals and his characteristic traits. The minimum eligibility is Class 12, followed by a course in communication and certification in image management. Aspirants should have excellent interpersonal skills, sound management skills and a passion for fashion.  Some of the notable image consultants are Renu Mehra, Nidhi Jagtiani, Neha Gupta and Samira Gupta, among other.  Courses and institutes  There are several short-term courses available in this domain. Some of the institutes offering an image management course are as follows:  ‚Äî Image Consulting Business Institute, New Delhi  ‚Äî Indian School of Image Management, Mumbai  ‚Äî Pearl Academy, New Delhi  ‚Äî International Image Consulting Institute, New Delhi  Salary and prospects:  There are several career options available in image consulting, including fashion blogger, beauty pageant and event stylist, jewellery and accessory stylist, bridal and wedding stylist, celebrity stylist, grooming and etiquette coach, corporate trainer and many more. A good image is the demand of the 21st century, and hence image consultants are sought-after by celebrities, corporates, politicians, companies, influencers, artists and many more.  Some of the top recruiters in this industry include Image Redefined, Suits Me, Style Puzzle, DressLife and many more.  Advertisement  The starting salary is Rs 10,000 to 15,000 monthly, which upgrades with experience. Staying up-to-date with the latest fashion trends, strong networking skills and taking specialised courses will help you stay ahead of your peers.  Doodle Artist  Do you know that doodling on the last pages of the notebook during lectures is now a full-time career option? Although a doodle appears to consist of simple abstract patterns and lines, these elements have a representational meaning. Doodling is an excellent option for presenting information graphically. Creativity, a flair for design, and sound knowledge of design tools are necessary for this profession. Doodle artists are employed by print houses, magazines, comics, animation companies, merchandising outlets, fashion houses and FMCG firms.  Courses and institutes  To become a doodle artist, one can choose courses such as Bachelor in Fine Arts (BFA), Bachelor‚Äôs in Visual Communication or Bachelor‚Äôs in Communication Design after Class 12. Try to gain an internship early on and gain relevant experience. Showcasing your portfolio on Behance and Pinterest always helps. Some of the institutions that can be the gateway to your doodling career are:  ‚Äî National Institute of Design  ‚Äî Indian Institute of Art and Design  ‚Äî Pearl Academy  ‚Äî National Institute of Fine Arts  Salary and prospects:  Advertisement  A doodle artist can work as a creative technologist, graphic recordist, comic book artist, whiteboard animator, children‚Äôs book illustrator, etc. They are highly in demand by creative and advertising agencies, film and production houses, media, gaming and entertainment firms. As a novice, you can expect a minimum salary of Rs 2.8 lakhs per annum which can go up to Rs 15-20 lakhs, depending upon your experience.  Tea Tasters  If you are a tea lover and looking to pursue it as a career option, choose tea tasting as your career. Tea tasters assess the quality of tea by tasting before scale and exploring blending options. A typical tea taster might taste around 100 samples daily during the peak season. Tea tasters are thoroughly abreast of tea production and trends, and can reveal much about tea merely by examining leaves.  Courses and institutes  There are currently no full-fledged courses available in tea tasting. However, the demand has spurred short-term certifications, which can be helpful. A Class 12 degree in science followed by a bachelor‚Äôs in Botany, Horticulture, Agricultural Sciences, and Food Science is a good starting point. Subsequently, candidates can opt for specialised courses in tea management. An in-depth understanding of the tea industry, strong sensory skills and decision-making skills are vital for tea tasters. Some of the institutes offering tea-tasting courses in India include  ‚Äî Assam Agricultural University  ‚Äî Dipras Institute of Professional Studies, Kolkata  ‚Äî Darjeeling Tea Research and Management Association, Darjeeling  ‚Äî University of North Bengal, Darjeeling  ‚Äî Birla Institute of Management and Futuristic Studies, Kolkata  ‚Äî Indian Institute of Plantation Management, Bangalore  Salary and prospects:  Many companies employ tea tasters to ensure quality and prepare specialised blends. Tea Tasters find jobs in plantations as well as tea trading businesses. You may also consider starting your own tea brand. Tea tasters earn around Rs 3 lakh per month, while specialists can easily expect a salary of Rs 6 lakh per annum.  Wedding Planner  Wedding planners plan ‚Äòthe special day‚Äô for people by taking care of all arrangements such as venue, d√©cor, guest lists, music, and catering. A typical job of a wedding planner begins with a consultation and deciding on specifics, followed by research, contracting, planning the flow of events and implementation. With destination weddings gaining momentum, wedding planners get to travel to exotic locations. Moreover, evolving wedding trends such as sustainability, limited guest lists, and demand for personalization have given a fillip to wedding planning as a career option. Wedding planners should have sound knowledge of aesthetics, good management skills, and an eye for detail and creativity.  Courses and institutes:  Advertisement  A bachelor‚Äôs degree in Event Management or Hospitality and Tourism Management can be the gateway to your career in wedding planning. Several institutes are offering short-term courses in the domain, which will add brownie points to your profile. Some of the institutes offering courses in wedding planning include:  ‚Äî Pearl Academy, Delhi and Noida  ‚Äî Tritya Institute of Event Management, New Delhi  ‚Äî Wedding Management Institute, New Delhi  Salary and prospects:  In India, people are willing to go the extra mile to make their weddings special. Wedding planners work in event management firms, wedding planning agencies, hotels and creative agencies. Some of the top recruiters include Devika Narain&Company, Savya Weddings, DeamKraftz, etc.  Advertisement  The salary of an entrant typically varies from Rs 15,000 to Rs 20,000 per month. A full-fledged wedding planner typically charges 10-15 per cent of the total wedding cost.  Food Stylists  If you credit photographers for making food look enticing in photographs, think again. Besides photographs, food stylists also play an important role in making food look attractive through garnishing, dressing and presentation skills. Flair for design, excellent photography and photo editing skills, and understanding of the colour palette and aesthetics are crucial skills for this profession. As a food stylist, you can work with magazines, advertising companies, photographers, restaurants, or freelancers.  Courses and institutes:  Advertisement  A degree in hotel management, culinary management and food service management comes in handy for this career. The minimum eligibility for these courses is Class 12 from any discipline with a minimum aggregate of 50 per cent marks. Some of the reputed institutes include  ‚Äî Institute of Hotel Management, Catering and Nutrition, New Delhi  ‚Äî Amity University, New Delhi  ‚Äî Galgotias University, Noida  ‚Äî UEI Global, New Delhi  Salary and prospects:  Food and hospitality are booming industries, with new food chains and fast-food joints opening almost every month. Most of these food chains are increasingly investing in their social media presence, increasing the demand for food stylists. As per Glassdoor, food stylists typically start with an average salary of Rs 16,000 per month, which increases with experience.  There are umpteen career options available to youth today. What is common among all these unconventional career choices is that they involve more skills, passion and innovation rather than pursuing specific educational background or a career path. So, if you dare to think beyond the obvious, opt for unconventional career paths where the sky is the limit.  (The writer is a Career Coach at Mindler)

The Kardashians: Trailer for season 3 to air on Disney+  The Kardashians: Trailer for season 3 to air on Disney+  Kim and Kourtney Kardashian are set to come to blows in the upcoming season of their reality TV show, but it's not the first time they've clashed over the years  Kourtney and Kim Kardashian's most explosive rows from physical fight to wedding feud  Kourtney and Kim Kardashian seem to be at war once again in the explosive new series of The Kardashians.  In a trailer for the upcoming season, which will be released on May 25, Kourtney lashes out at her sister as she accuses the SKIMS founder of using her her wedding to Travis Barker as a "business opportunity".  Kourtney and Travis tied the knot last year in the beautiful coastal village of Portofino, Italy, with their wedding sponsored by Dolce & Gabbana.  Just months later however, Kim was unveiled as the face of the fashion brand's Spring/Summer 2023 ad campaign.  "People think it's a misunderstanding, it's not. It's who she is to her core," Kourtney said in the trailer as she went on a scathing rant about Kim.  It's safe to say the new Hulu series will be full of drama, but it's not the first time the famous sisters have been caught up in an apparent feud.  Here, we take a look back at some of Kourtney and Kim's biggest rows.  Kim's diamond earring devastation  Image: E!) E!)  Kim was devastated back in 2011 when her expensive diamond earring was lost in the ocean, but Kourtney was far from sympathetic.  The famous family were enjoying a trip to Bora Bora, but disaster struck for Kim when she lost the $75,000 (¬£60,000) piece of jewellery and she was left in tears.  Kim was thrown into the water by her husband-at-the-time Kris Humphries and her earring came lose after landing in the ocean.  Image: E!) E!)  She screamed: "My earring's gone! F**k, oh my God I'm gonna cry. My diamond earring," before adding: "We're not going to find it in the ocean."  While Kim managed to gain sympathy from her momager Kris Jenner, sister Kourtney was less than impressed.  Appearing from one of the family's huts to see what all of the commotion was about, she scolded: "Kim, there's people that are dying."  Cruel appearance jibe  Image: E!) E!)  Things got nasty during a 2018 fight between Kim and Kourtney, as the family tried to organise their annual Christmas cars photoshoot.  While Kim tried to schedule a date, Kourtney said she was unavailable and refused to adjust her schedule to accommodate for Kim's business meetings.  "I'm leaving at 4pm and I don't care what anyone says," Kourtney insisted.  Kim explained to their mother: "That was when my meeting was."  As Kourtney suggested Kim should change her meeting to 7am, Kim became increasingly annoyed and shouted: "Get the f**k out of here and go.  Image: E!) E!)  "No one wants you in the f***ing shoot. I'm planning this, so we don't want you in the shoot."  Kourtney hit back and said she didn't care about the shoot.  Eventually, Kim had enough and shouted: "Maybe if you had a f**king business that you were passionate about then you would know what it takes to run a f**king business, but you don't. So don't even act like you know what I'm talking about."  When Kourtney walked away, Kim declared: "She's the least exciting to look at, so she can be out. She doesn't do s**t."  Style thief  Image: E!) E!)  During a 2019 episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Kim accused Kourtney of stealing her style.  The Poosh founder was joined by sister Khloe Kardashian as she tried on outfits for her birthday party.  As Kourtney styled a sparkly pink minidress, Khloe suggested they call Kim for her opinion, but Kourtney said she didn't trust her sisters judgement.  While on the video call, Kim said: "Well, if you don't care, why do you keep picking out all the same clothes?"  Image: E!) E!)  Kourtney hit back: "I don't know what you're talking about. I've never dressed like you."  Kim further lashed out at her sister for reaching out to Thierry Mugler, despite the SKIMS founder having a special relationship with the designer.  Kourtney later branded the argument "ridiculous".  "Kim and I have completely different styles, so even if we wear the same designer, we wear it in a completely different way.  "The store may send me clothes that are more Kim's style, and I send them back."  Things get physical  Image: E!) E!)  Kim and Kourtney's most notorious fight came in 2020, when Kim accused Kourtney of not showing up enough for the family business.  Kim claimed their mother Kris was always "crying and begging" her and Khloe to show up to events because she knew the other family members had different priorities.  However, Kourtney took offence to the comments and insisted she does work hard.  "You have this narrative in your mind," she slammed. "I will literally f**k you up if you mention it again."  Kourtney then angrily threw a bottle of water at Kim, prompting the mother-of-four to jump to her feet and start a physical fight.  Image: E!) E!)  Kourtney was left in tears after her sister punched her.  Khloe was forced to break the fight up, before Kim accused Kourtney of scratching her and proceeded to slap her sister.  Kim later spoke about the moment on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, saying: "I don't ever normally resort to violence like that, but she scratched me so hard.  "When I looked down at my arm and I saw she'd really scratched me and I felt it all on my back, I just went over and slapped her back. It's not my proudest moment." ¬© Provided by PairedLife  Wedding ceremonies are often associated with white dresses and traditional bridal attire, but some brides are breaking free from the norms and embracing their unique style on their special day. One such bride recently caught the attention of onlookers and social media users alike with her non-traditional and vibrant wedding dress. In the video, we see a bride's awe-inspiring entrance down the aisle on her wedding day, capturing everyone's attention with her vibrant and unconventional attire. The bride confidently struts forward, donning a form flattering, pink-hued wedding dress adorned with a plethora of multi-colored flowers. The dress, with its eye catching design, exudes a sense of whimsy and individuality, making it clear that this bride is unafraid to defy tradition. In recent years, brides have been wholeheartedly embracing the opportunity to express their individuality and unique style through their wedding looks. Instead, brides are fearlessly exploring new horizons, opting for non-traditional and personalized outfits that reflect their personality, preferences, and passions. From colorful and unconventional wedding dresses to themed ensembles inspired by various cultures or eras, brides are redefining the boundaries of bridal fashion.  As more and more brides embrace their individuality and infuse their wedding attire with creativity and vibrancy, we can look forward to a future where wedding fashion becomes a canvas for personal storytelling, celebrating the beauty of diversity and self-expression. Resham, the veteran diva of the entertainment industry, continues to captivate audiences with her illustrious career spanning both films and television. Having started her journey with PTV, she quickly transitioned into films and achieved immense success. Resham‚Äôs unwavering dedication and talent have ensured her relevance in the industry even today, although she now chooses to work on selective projects.  Apart from her on-screen presence, Resham is frequently seen gracing various social events, much to the delight of her fans. Recently, she attended a friend‚Äôs wedding in Lahore, where she embraced the festive atmosphere and enjoyed herself to the fullest. One particular moment caught the attention of onlookers when she took to the dance floor with designer and close friend, Faraz Mannan, grooving to the beats of a lively song.  However, Resham‚Äôs joyous celebration at the wedding didn‚Äôt escape criticism from some quarters. Critics voiced their concerns, arguing that the nation is currently facing challenging times, and such exuberant displays seem disconnected from the harsh realities faced by many. This criticism was rooted in the belief that public figures should be more mindful of the circumstances and demonstrate a greater sense of empathy towards the struggles faced by the general population.  While Resham‚Äôs enthusiasm at the wedding might have invited mixed reactions, it is important to remember that individuals, including celebrities, seek moments of respite and joy even in difficult times. Engaging in festivities and embracing moments of happiness can serve as a temporary escape from the challenges of reality. It is crucial to strike a balance between acknowledging the hardships faced by the nation and allowing oneself to find solace and enjoyment in personal moments.  View this post on Instagram  Resham‚Äôs career achievements and her continuous presence in the industry are testaments to her talent and hard work. As she navigates her professional journey, it is important to respect her personal choices and recognize that individuals, regardless of their public status, have the right to find happiness and enjoy social events while also being mindful of their responsibilities as public figures.  View this post on Instagram  Critiques aside, Resham remains a celebrated figure in the entertainment industry, admired by countless fans for her contributions and accomplishments throughout her career. Her enduring popularity is a testament to her talent and the mark she has left on the hearts of her admirers.

A 30-year-old man was declared dead at Oshakati State Hospital after allegedly consuming alcohol at a wedding in the Omusati region on Saturday.  The police have reported that the man, identified as Kleophas Tuulitate Shivolo, became sick after consuming alcohol at a wedding at Onangolo in the Omusati region on Saturday afternoon.  He was declared dead by medical officers after he had been taken to hospital.  The police stated that according to available information, Shivolo previously had heart surgery and was advised by a medical doctor not to consume alcohol.  The cause of his death is not yet known, while the result of a post-mortem investigation on his body is being awaited.

When Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's engagement and wedding photographer received a call to cover the ceremony, he thought it was a prank. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex married at St George's Chapel in Windsor Castle on May 19, 2018. Prince Harry- Meghan Markle: Harry and Meghan are seen. (Instagram)  The couple first met in the summer of 2016 after being set up by a mutual friend. Then in November 2017, Harry proposed to Meghan, before the couple married six months later.  Professional photographer Alexi Lubomirski thought he was being pranked when he received a call to shoot their engagement photos.  ‚ÄúWhen I got off the phone, I said, 'I think Kensington Palace just called me?' Two days later I was sitting in front of Harry and Meghan talking concepts,‚Äù he said.  The British photographer said he was inspired by an iconic photoshoot of Audrey Hepburn's husband Mel Ferrer wrapping her in his coat and asked Prince Harry to do the same with Meghan Markle.  ‚ÄúIt just popped in my head because I saw his overcoat and I said, 'Can you put that on?' And then everything just starts folding together,‚Äù the photographer said. In one photo from the shoot, Meghan is all smiles as she shows her engagement ring.  SHARE THIS ARTICLE ON

In an interview with the Irish Mail on Sunday, the star of RT√â's crime drama Clean Sweep said: ‚ÄòWe had to get Covid married, as I called it, because we couldn't see each other. He was filming in Atlanta and he couldn't come to me and I couldn't come to him - I wasn't allowed in.‚Äô  Charlene McKenna at her 'covid wedding'. Pic: Instagram  Charlene continued: ‚ÄòSo we had to crack on and do the wedding. We did the four people thing and we got legally married because then I could go the States. It was a freezing winter, and it was really lovely and it was very quiet.  'And then in the summer we had our wedding in Castle Leslie; we had the pub at the gate so we had a hooley in there the next day as well. We're both one of six [children] and we didn't want [too many celebrities], so our immediate family is about 55 people, so it was 75 or something.  ‚ÄòBut Jimmy [Nesbitt] was there. He was the star of the show - everyone loved him, and he's great. He's a good friend.'  Charlene has been a working actor for more than 20 years, but she has had to overcome many challenges during her career, including being 'a weird casting choice'.  James Nesbitt attends the Walpole British Luxury Awards 2019 at The Dorchester in 2019 in London. Pic: Getty Images  She ‚Äòsaid: I‚Äôve been told that a lot. I've never been really commercial. I've been told I'm too ugly, I'm too pretty, I'm too harsh. I guess I'm just me, and you just have to get philosophical.'  But with a series of high-profile roles under her belt, including as the mysterious IRA leader Captain Swing in Peaky Blinders, Charlene says she wouldn't have it any other way.  'I do like to be challenged; I am easily bored,' she admits. Aside from playing the lead role as Shelly in Clean Sweep, Charlene has also branched out into production work.  After receiving the script for the RT√â drama, she wanted to broaden her repertoire, so McKenna approached the show's producers and asked to be given an executive producing role.  The producers certainly listened, and Charlene even had an input into the choice of Barry Ward, who plays her husband Jason Mohan in the series.  You Might Also Like PICS: Charlene McKenna and husband Adam amongst loved-up stars at SAGs  'In my battle about who's playing my husband that was important, because I want the best team,' she said. 'I don't want to get cowed, and they [the cast] ended being the loveliest bunch of people, but you don't know that before you've gone in.'  Charlene now divides her time between her home in New York and Monaghan, where she said growing up with five brothers hardened her from a young age.  Charlene McKenna in Clean Sweep. Pic: RTE  'It was robust and tough,' she said of her childhood. 'And you got the corners knocked off you. I'm a weird mix of a tomboy and a princess; I've no problem getting down and dirty, doing the lads' stuff, the girls' stuff.'  This, she says, has enabled her to take criticism on the chin. 'I'm a worrier by nature -I'm super-sensitive. You just have to let it [criticism] go, and if people don't like you just hope they aren't mean about it.  'I just always hope it's good enough and that people like it. Your job is to entertain people and take them away for an hour.'  Clean Sweep continues on RT√â One on Sunday at 9.30pm. All six episodes are available on the RT√â Player.

Escape To The Chateau's Dick and Angel break silence after parting ways with Channel 4  Escape To The Chateau's Dick and Angel break silence after parting ways with Channel 4  Escape to the Chateau's Dick and Angel have reportedly 'suspended enquiries' regarding their business in France after Channel 4 said they would not be working with the couple in the future  Escape To The Chateau‚Äôs Dick and Angel ‚Äòpause wedding business‚Äô after ‚Äòbullying claims‚Äô  Dick and Angel Strawbridge won't be taking on any new bookings at their chateau amid 'bullying claims', according to reports.  The Escape to the Chateau stars amassed of legion of loyal fans from their Channel 4 show, and offered a ¬£38,000 wedding service at their French mansion.  However, the couple's website currently says: "We are currently on a two-year weddings ‚Äòcatch-up‚Äô, we will reopen enquiries as soon as we can!"  The couple's other services, including a Chateau Under the Stars experience, which costs ¬£350 per night and a ¬£75 Working Garden Day are also 'currently unavailable'.  The reality stars have been slammed recently by those allegedly working close to the couple.  Image: Channel 4) Channel 4) Image: escape_to_the_chateau/Instagram) escape_to_the_chateau/Instagram)  The reports come just days after Channel 4 told the Mirror they had decided to part ways with Dick and Angel "following a review" after years of working together.  A representative for Channel 4 told us: "Following a review we have taken the decision to not work with Dick and Angel on any new productions in the future."  Meanwhile, a source told the Daily Mail: "Dick and Angel come across on screen as the most gorgeous and lovely couple, literally like butter wouldn't melt, but they're not like that off-screen.  "It's a full-on show, production is with them at the chateau for weeks so they can't hide their real characters ‚Äì they can't turn it on for two hours of recording and then not go back to their real persona.  Image: Channel 4) Channel 4)  "They're just spiky and volatile people and, as you can imagine, that's a nightmare to work with."  The reality star couple have been married since 2015 and share two children - while 63-year-old Dick has two other kids from a previous marriage.  Fans loved their fairytale story as the couple renovated a 19th-century, 45-bedroom Ch√¢teau de la Motte-Husson in Martign√©-sur-Mayenne, France.  However, it seems the dream has turned into a bit of nightmare with Two Rivers Media confirming to the Mirror they also have cut ties and will no longer be working with the couple.  A spokesperson said: "We can confirm that we will no longer work with Dick and Angel and cannot comment further at the moment.‚Äù  Dick and Angel, however, seemed unfazed when they made their first social media posts recently to share a clip of their children Arthur and Dorothy hanging out outside the chateau.  They wrote alongside the video: ‚ÄúLast weekend we went for a Spring walk around the grounds‚Ä¶it‚Äôs nature at its best, and there was something for everyone to be excited about! Simple and beautiful.‚Äù  The Mirror has contacted Dick and Angel's reps for comment.  * Follow Mirror Celebs on Snapchat, Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.

STOP whatever you are doing and for a moment just imagine a kaleidoscope of colors and loud boisterous laughter among thumps of ‚Äòdhol‚Äô and the gorgeous aroma of food wafting through the doors‚Ä¶ you got it right! It‚Äôs a Punjabi wedding scene!!!  The Sikh culture revolves around the belief that the sure-shot way to a full and peaceful life is through giving and receiving love because bonds like marriages are seen as a key to getting closer to the divine.  As it is always asserted, Sikhism‚Äôs central principle is equality and a wedding reflects just that: equal union and purpose for both man and woman.  A fiesta of celebration through songs, dance, prayer, togetherness, the opulent Sikh culture, and rich Punjabi traditions make the entire wedding process enchanting‚Ä¶like a fairytale.  Having talked about the spiritual and religious bit of Punjabi weddings, now let us dive headlong into the fun part of the celebrations; it starts with the ‚ÄòRoka‚Äô and ‚ÄòThaka‚Äô ceremonies where the consent of parents and elders of the family is sought.  While all the pre-wedding rituals are taking place, there is a parallel search going on! ‚ÄòThe ‚ÄòAuntyjis‚Äô flaunting their ‚ÄòCanada returned‚Äô son or daughter! Looking for a suitable match, exaggerating about their achievements, bragging about their ‚ÄòKothis‚Äô, and so on!! In the midst of this hullabaloo, what comes to rescue is always ‚ÄúPunjabi Music‚Äù! The thumping beats of dhol and peppy lyrics have become souls of a wedding, be it a Punjabi one or one from any other culture or country.  So much so that no ‚Äúshaadi‚Äù can be complete without a ‚Äúkaala chashma‚Äù from the Bollywood movie ‚ÄòBaar Baar Dekho‚Äô or a ‚ÄúSaturday Saturday‚Äù from ‚ÄòHumpty Sharma ki Dulhaniya‚Äô, Punjabi music has taken all our weddings by storm. Even across the border, Pakistani ‚Äònikkahs‚Äô are incomplete without grooving to Punjabi songs.  Anyways, back at the wedding, the ‚ÄòMaiya‚Äô and ‚ÄòVatnaa‚Äô takes place where the respective relatives of the bride and groom apply a mixture of turmeric, and mustard oil on their body to make their skin clean and glowing. Like others, these festivities take place amongst songs sung by women and dancing by relatives.  Again, it will not be an exaggeration to say that this tradition is being portrayed even in South Indian weddings! Even in Netflix series ‚ÄòBridgerton‚Äô, the second season partakes a Haldi ceremony‚Ä¶Punjabi wedding traditions in British television series!!  Next is the ‚ÄòWarna‚Äô ceremony when relatives wave money around the couple‚Äôs heads. This money is usually donated to charity or distributed among house help. What is fun to watch is the fact that Punjabis always have a never-ending supply of 10-Ruppee notes for ‚ÄòNazar Utarana‚Äô. This goes on and on till the bride reaches her ‚ÄòSasural‚Äô. The weddings progress with ‚ÄòMehendi‚Äô and ‚ÄòKalire‚Äô ceremonies. Talking about ‚Äòmehendi‚Äô, any wedding, of any cultural background, cannot take place without this fuction and ‚Äòkalire‚Äô have become the Bollywood bride‚Äôs quintessential ornament!  As the groom gets dressed in splendid attire just like the bride and guests, the gravity of the celebration comes forth. It‚Äôs larger than life! The riot of colors; pinks, reds, yellows, purple, the bling of gold, not to forget the contagious spirit!! Thus, begins the never-ending journey, ‚ÄòBaraat‚Äô. Here all the dancers come alive. Cousins go berserk, uncles do ‚ÄòNagin‚Äô dance, aunties give ‚Äòthumkas‚Äô, but the groom? The poor guy just sits on the ‚Äòghodi and smiles while giving ‚Äògalis‚Äô in his heart. Does nobody realize the hurry he is in!! Once the baraat reaches the wedding venue, the bride‚Äôs family welcomes the groom‚Äôs family with gifts and warm hugs. Wait! Do you think a Punjabi wedding can progress so far without lavish food and drinks? Not at all!  Food, spreads of it, is a central part of Punjabi life. All this while, as the celebrations are taking place, there are tables loaded with ‚Äòchole bhature‚Äô, ‚Äòtandoori chicken‚Äô, ‚Äònaans‚Äô, ‚Äòkulchas‚Äô, ‚Äògulab jamuns‚Äô, ‚Äòphirnis‚Äô‚Ä¶ phew‚Ä¶ the list is endless. But there‚Äôs still a missing link. You know what I‚Äôm talking about! Right? Yes, ‚Äòcar-o-bar‚Äô time! At all weddings, there are men who keep coming and going out of the events with big smiles plastered on their faces. A vital requisite of a Punjabi wedding is ‚Äòdaaru‚Äô without which festivities are incomplete.  Getting back on track again, ‚ÄòAnand Karaj‚Äô takes place next. After bowing down before the Guru Granth Sahib, the bride and groom start the Laavas (wedding vows) while circling around the Holy Book. Back to food as the ceremony concludes! The guests are served a vegetarian lunch at the Gurudwara. In the evening, a reception is planned by the Groom‚Äôs family to welcome the newly-wed couple. Finally, it‚Äôs ‚ÄòVidai‚Äô time and the bride says her final goodbyes as her parents and relatives bless her and set her off on a new journey!  All in all, just like their energy and zest for life, Punjabi weddings are king-size! They do not believe in mediocrity. Everything, from clothes to jewelry, from food to music, has to be exquisite and glorified. That is a Punjabi wedding. Beautiful. Fun. Pious. Over-the-top. And an integral part of Bollywood. It seems like Punjabi weddings have captured the Indian movies completely for no wedding in a Hindi movie can happen without a Punjabi silhouette; music, food, attire, traditions‚Ä¶there‚Äôs a bit of Punjab everywhere!!  To wrap up, it can be easily seen that these days Punjabi wedding traditions can be witnessed not just in Indian cultures and religions but globally. They have become infused in everybody‚Ä¶undivided by caste or creed.  (Image and text credit: Khalsavox.com)

The Wedding Celebration: Joy and Chaos Unveiled  In a shocking turn of events, the celebration of a recent marriage took an unexpected twist when the newly wedded groom found himself behind bars. Dawood, a PTI worker from Peshawar, was among several individuals wanted in connection to the violent incidents that occurred on May 9. Little did he know that his wedding would become entangled in the web of chaos.  The wedding ceremony was initially a joyous affair, with a plethora of guests in attendance, including prominent local figures like Basri, a former member of the assembly for PTI. Family, friends, and well-wishers gathered to celebrate the union of two souls, unaware of the storm that awaited them.  From Wedding Bliss to Viral Nightmare  As the night progressed, the atmosphere quickly shifted from jubilant to tense. Authorities arrived at the scene, seeking to apprehend Dawood and other PTI workers allegedly involved in the violent events earlier that month. Chaos ensued, leaving the bride and guests bewildered and terrified.  The unfolding drama took a viral turn when an image of Dawood, dressed in his wedding attire, handcuffed in court, made its way across social media platforms. The juxtaposition of joy and despair in the photograph captivated the attention of the nation, sparking discussions and debates about the circumstances surrounding the incident.  The wedding that was meant to be a joyous occasion will now forever be remembered for the unfortunate turn of events that unfolded, leaving the couple and their loved ones grappling with an unexpected and unsettling aftermath.

A couple returned from their honeymoon only to find that the groom's parents had opened their gifts.  The cards and boxes were thrown away too.    Now, the couple can't return any of the gifts and can't send personalised thank you notes to guests.  Wedding excitement doesn't end when the bride tosses the bouquet and the couple jets off on honeymoon.  Opening wedding gifts after their return is a delightful part of the process. In fact, in some parts of the world, people observe gift-opening etiquettes.  However, one couple returned from their honeymoon to find that the groom's parents had taken the liberty of opening their gifts while they were away.    READ MORE | 'The entitlement is legendary': Bride-to-be shares her cousin's awkward wedding request  The frustrated bride told Reddit that she believed her in-laws had overstepped the boundary.  "She and my father-in-law opened every single wedding present my husband and I received, threw every box away and proceeded to reorganise the entire kitchen. I feel so violated while also feeling so overwhelmed by the task of trying to get things back to how they were."  She recalled that her mother-in-law called her the day after their wedding, as they were leaving for their honeymoon, and asked them how she could be of assistance. She and her husband responded that they could replace the old plates and bowls and swap the old toaster.    READ MORE | Dad refuses to pay for daughter‚Äôs fourth wedding - ‚ÄòI will help her with the next one‚Äô  Newsletter Daily Life Take a breather in your busy day with this curated collection of real-life stories, sitdown interviews, everyday tips and expert insights.  "Now, I can't return a single thing. I can't find anything in my kitchen. I used love to cook and would combat my lack of appetite by getting excited about trying a new recipe or perfecting a new dish. Now, I don't even want to be in my kitchen because I can't find anything and the process of looking usually leads to finding out they moved or threw away something important to me," the bride said.  She added that she had tried to let it go, but the thought of having to write a hundred "thank you" notes made the situation even more painful for her.  She also feels like her safe space has been taken away from her and she doesn't know how to fix it.    READ MORE | 'I did nothing wrong': Mom invites entire family to son's destination wedding without his knowledge  Would you like to share your special day? Tell us your story here.    Users stepped into the comments section to advise the woman.  One commenter said: "Make sure she (the mother-in-law) has no access, no keys, change locks or codes if needed. Then talk to your husband about consequences for her. Serious ones. It's his job, communicate both of your boundaries were broken."  Another suggested that she should expose her mother-in-law: "Call her out in the 'thank you' notes. Tell people you can't properly thank them for their individual gifts they gave because she opened everything and tossed the cards and boxes. Now everyone knows and it might be enough of a consequence."    Source: Reddit

The changing role of families in Indian wedding culture  Indian weddings are renowned for their grandeur and cultural significance, deeply rooted in traditions that have been passed down through generations. However, as society evolves and modernises, so does the institution of marriage and the roles played by families in Indian weddings. In recent years, a discernible shift has taken place, redefining the dynamics and responsibilities of families during this momentous celebration.  The International Day of Families, observed on May 15 each year, serves as a meaningful occasion to not only acknowledge the importance of families but also to examine their role in shaping cultural practices, such as weddings, within specific contexts. In Indian society, where weddings hold immense significance and where the wedding market is a $50 bn+ industry, it is crucial to explore the evolving dynamics of families within this realm. Let's take a deeper look to understand the changing dynamics and emerging trends:  Embracing Individual Choices:  Traditionally, Indian weddings were initiated, decided and planned by parents and elders, with limited inputs from the couple. However, in contemporary Indian society, there is a growing emphasis on individual choices and preferences. Couples are increasingly empowered to make decisions not only regarding choosing their partners but also around their wedding ceremonies, guest lists, their choice of wedding venues and vendors as well as every possible detail around their special day. Families are happily adapting to this paradigm shift by embracing the desires and aspirations of the couple, encouraging personal autonomy while providing guidance and support as we see an increasing focus on prioritising the couple's happiness in the celebration.  Collaborative Planning:  Gone are the days when wedding planning was solely the responsibility of the bride's family. Today, families on both sides actively participate in the planning process, creating a collaborative and inclusive environment. Parents and siblings of the bride and groom discuss ideas, share responsibilities, and work together to organise a memorable event. There is also an increasing trend of many events being shared between the families. This collective involvement fosters stronger bonds between families and promotes a sense of unity, as they collectively embark on the journey of celebrating love and commitment.  Changing financial realities have prompted a re-evaluation of spending areas  Indian weddings have long been known for their lavishness, with elaborate ceremonies, opulent decorations, and extravagant feasts. However, changing financial realities have prompted a re-evaluation of spending areas. So while on one side many families have been opting for intimate and budget-conscious celebrations we also do continue seeing higher-budget weddings the common thread in all is prioritising personal experiences. This shift has resulted in a more balanced and inclusive approach, where families come together to contribute their resources, equally distributing the financial burden, easing it for both sides, and ensuring a memorable wedding without compromising on quality. We have also observed that couples financing their own weddings is becoming quite common in India, especially amongst millennials. Our data survey revealed that almost 40 per cent of them have contributed in one way or the other in the new normal.  Redefining customs:  Owing to the cultural shifts, families are becoming more open to the ideas and preferences of all. This is also leading to a shift in societal norms and traditions. These days families are redefining customs as per the preferences and convenience of their loved ones. For instance, our September 2021 data survey reported a 76 per cent surge in the demand for non-saaya wedding dates. Even though this surge was primarily driven by the pandemic and cancellations, it has stayed snd it depicts the change in the mindset of the new generation. This shift is also evident in multiple other customs such as the division of gifting between groom and bride's family, acceptance of a woman priest, and letting go of traditions like Kanyadaan and Bidaai.  Blending Traditions with Modernity:  While families adapt to changing dynamics, they also strive to preserve their cultural heritage. The changing role of families in Indian wedding culture involves finding a delicate balance between honouring traditions and embracing modernity. Families are re-imagining rituals, incorporating new elements, and experimenting with innovative ideas while staying rooted in the essence of their cultural practices. This harmonious blend of tradition and modernity reflects the evolving Indian society, where families celebrate their customs while embracing the winds of change.  The changing role of families in Indian wedding culture reflects the larger shifts happening in society. With a focus on individual choices, collaborative planning, financial prudence, gender equality, and cultural evolution, families are redefining the way weddings are organised and celebrated. These changes not only foster stronger bonds between families but also empower individuals to embrace their uniqueness. As Indian weddings continue to evolve, the changing roles of families serve as a testament to the adaptability, inclusiveness, and resilience of Indian society while continuously reminding us of the fact that no celebration is complete till you have your family to celebrate it with.  (Anam Zubair, is the Head of Marketing, at WeddingWire India)

THE COUPLE  Sade, human resources, and John, solicitor.  THEY LIVE  in Dublin.  THE VENUE  Ballymagarvey Village.  PHOTOGRAPHY  Olga Hogan Photography.  THEY MET  We met in college at the University of Limerick, where we both studied over 11 years ago.  THE PROPOSAL  We travelled to Paris in March 2020 ‚Äì I was on the fence about going at first as Covid had just arrived in Italy, but John was adamant that the trip must go ahead. Less than three hours in Paris and we were engaged, and his determination all made sense. John was so nervous; it was hard to decipher what exactly was going on until he got down on one knee and eventually was able to muster: ‚ÄúWill you marry me?‚Äù.  The weather in Paris was just perfect and the city was less crowded than usual, so we got to explore our little engagement bubble before returning to reality. Despite the uncertainty that was waiting for us when we returned home regarding Covid, one thing was for certain ‚Äì we were going to spend the rest of our lives together.  THE DRESS AND THE SUIT  I found my absolute dream dress at Vintage Pearl Bridal. The designer is Made With Love ‚Äì it‚Äôs simple and elegant, but still fun with the beaded sequins and low back. Anna O Alterations created the detachable cape veil as well.  John had a custom suit made at Louis Copeland & Sons, which included travel-themed lining to represent our travels as a couple and an embroidered date on the collar.

Yoo Jae Suk was applauded for keeping his promise to officiate at the wedding ceremony of Youtubers 'Enjoy Couple'.      Earlier, it was reported that popular YouTubers and comedians 'Enjoy Couple' tied the knot, after dating for ten years. The couple, Im Lala and Son Min Soo, made their debut as comedians on the comedy shows 'Smile People' and 'Comedy Big League', respectively, but later transitioned over to becoming full-time YouTubers after facing difficulties finding success on major broadcasts. They quickly grew into a channel that garnered more than 2 million subscribers, and many loyal fans have followed them throughout their journey to get to where they are today. Thus, news of their marriage garnered a lot of attention and praise.  In particular, the couple previously appeared as guests on the variety show 'Yoo Quiz On The Block' back in 2020, where they sat down to talk about their career and lives with MC Yoo Jae Suk and comedian Jo Se Ho. Here, they were able to secure a promise from Yoo Jae Suk that he would officiate their wedding ceremony if they were to get married within the next few years. While the atmosphere had been filled with humor and jokes on the set, many were pleasantly surprised to find out that Yoo Jae Suk had actually kept his promise to the couple, touching many hearts as it is well known that he is the most sought-after MC in all of Korea.

After being together for over a decade, Pimblett finally popped the question on a trip to Thailand in 2020. Gregory has appeared frequently in Paddy Pimblett's YouTube videos, and the two are frequently seen partying and testing out food together.  Gregory shared several pictures on Instagram from her trip to Barcelona with her friends, in which they can be seen both partying at nightclubs and relaxing by the pool. Some of her friends posed for pictures while aboard a yacht while others wore Paddy Pimblett masks.  Despite enjoying herself, she said separation anxiety was setting in and she yearned to return to Pimblett. She captioned the posts:  "Last of the Barca pics. The separation anxiety is kicking in hard. Had the best time with my girls love use so much. Can we go back now?" Matt Frevola doubles down on his stance on why he should be fighting Paddy Pimblett next  Several fighters, including UFC lightweight Matt Frevolo, fancy their chances of beating rising star Paddy Pimblett. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a wedding day and night I‚Äôll never forget,‚Äù Nicola tells the Sunday World as she relives the amazing experience  Groom Kevin and Nicola with Nathan Carter at his show  Irish country music fan Nicola Smith enjoyed the wedding of her dreams when she tied the knot with long-time love Kevin Corrigan.  In addition to her marriage, Nicola from Saggart, Co Dublin, also landed the opportunity to spend her wedding night in the company of country heart-throb Nathan Carter.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a wedding day and night I‚Äôll never forget,‚Äù Nicola tells the Sunday World as she relives the amazing experience.  As a busy mother juggling the demands of three children‚Äî Aoife, Jack and Daniel ‚Äî bubbly Nicola, who is also a big fan of Cliona Hagan, says she doesn‚Äôt get the chance to see the Irish country singers performing live.  In fact, until her wedding night, she had never been to a Nathan Carter concert, which made the experience all the more special.  Nicola and Kevin on their wedding day  ‚ÄúKevin and myself got married in the registry office in Dublin on the day of Nathan‚Äôs concert with just our children and our parents at the ceremony,‚Äù Nicola reveals.  ‚ÄúWhen we picked the day we did a search to see what was on entertainment-wise. I just absolutely love country music and I couldn‚Äôt believe it when we discovered that Nathan was playing at the Bord Gais theatre.  ‚ÄúI emailed his management telling them it was our wedding day and would there be any chance of meeting Nathan at the show. It was a lovely surprise when his manager (John Farry) came back and said that Nathan would be delighted to meet us.‚Äù  The couple booked into the nearby Grand Canal Hotel for their wedding night and enjoyed a pre-concert dinner together in the hotel before the show.  Then the icing on the (wedding) cake was their backstage pass to get up close and personal with the Wagon Wheel superstar.  ‚ÄúNathan was so lovely, down to earth and easy to chat to,‚Äù Nicola says. ‚ÄúI think he was amazed that we had just got married a few hours earlier and had chosen to be at his concert for our wedding night.  ‚ÄúWe had a lovely chat and had some photos taken. Nathan was also playing at the Bord Gais the following night and he then gave us a little wedding gift of tickets to that show as well.  ‚ÄúSo, from never having the chance to see him before, I got to watch him two nights in a row.  ‚ÄúI brought my mum and daughter to his concert the following night and they were just so excited as well. The memories I have from those two days and nights are just fabulous.  Nicola and Kevin on their wedding day  ‚ÄúNathan is an amazing performer and he puts on such a great show. It really had everything, including a big choir.  People loved it all and it was such a brilliant atmosphere in the theatre.  ‚ÄúAs wedding days go, it was certainly an unusual one.‚Äù  Nicola and Kevin, who, she says, ‚Äúmet randomly‚Äù despite both being from Saggart, have been together for seven years and now have a more elaborate wedding ceremony organised for next month in Lanzarote.  They will be joined by a party of more than 50 family and friends.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid Nathan isn‚Äôt our wedding band, but he‚Äôs more than welcome to come,‚Äù Nicola jokes.  Country kingpin Carter, who is hosting a weekend of shows at the Gleneagle INEC in Killarney, Co Kerry this weekend, says he felt honoured that Nicola and Kevin chose his recent Dublin concerts in the Bord Gais Energy Theatre as the entertainment on their wedding day.  ‚ÄúObviously getting married is the biggest day of your life, so for a couple to make you a part of that special moment is a real honour,‚Äù Nathan says.  ‚ÄúNicola and Kevin are a lovely couple and I enjoyed meeting them on their wedding day.  ‚ÄúThey were so relaxed and just seemed to be taking it all in their stride.‚Äù  The last time Nathan played the Bord Gais Energy Theatre was in July 2016 ‚Äî and he arrived at the show by helicopter after earlier performing at a wedding in the North for a thrilled husband and wife who won the prize in a competition.  ‚ÄúI had a ball playing two gigs in one day,‚Äù Nathan said.
